did.unittitle: 1996 Vol. XIV
Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 1

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Program Content: Year in Review

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 2

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Lifebeat, “The Music Industry Fights AIDS”
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water

2. Lou Maletta interviews Jean MB Genasci, Vice President of Affiliate Development for PFLAG (Parents, Families, and Friends of Lesbians and Gays), regarding PFLAG’s Project Open Mind. Includes two PFLAG advertisement commercials.
3. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Hank Aaron
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: “Panic Disorder: It’s real. It’s treatable”, National Institute of Mental Health
5. Lou Maletta interviews Marya Triandafellos and Patricia Lewis, [Gay Games IV participants], regarding the film “Black and Blue and Gold”. Includes film footage.
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A
6. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: Urban AID 4 Lifebeat, “The Music Industry Fights AIDS”

7. “Lambda Update”: Beatrice Dohrn, Legal Director of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta’s interview with Catherine Hanssens, Lambda AIDS Project Director, regarding policy work and litigation concerning sex clubs.
8. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Nikki Franke
9. Lou Maletta interviews Colin Martin, playwright/actor, regarding his play “Virgins and Other Myths”.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 3

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water
2. Interview: Dr. Billy Jones and Doug Robinson, former Gay Men’s Health Crisis (GMHC) Board Members, discuss their resignation from GMHC.
3. AIDS News
4. Interview: Matt Foreman, Executive Director of the Anti-Violence Project, discusses a recent string of robberies at gay bars.
5. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Willie Davis
6. Entertainment News
7. Lou Maletta interviews Erik Sherman, author, regarding his book “Out at Home: The Glenn Burke Story”.
8. Lou Maletta interviews David Rothenberg, [activist and theatre producer], discusses his personal life and his one-man show “At War With the Dinosaurs”.
COMMERCIAL: “Panic Disorder: It’s real. It’s treatable”, National Institute of Mental Health
9. Interview: Robert Hilferty, [activist], discusses the course he teaches called “Homosexual Subtext: Hide-and-Seek at the Movies”.
10. Lou Maletta interviews Geoff Thompson, regarding his 1996 calendar “If You Want My Body” and the group home he runs.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 4

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water
COMMERCIAL: “Panic Disorder: It’s real. It’s treatable”, National Institute of Mental Health
2. Interview: Christopher Lynn, Taxi & Limousine Commissioner, discusses a controversy regarding his pre-suspension of a taxi driver.
3. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Nikki Franke
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A
5. Interview: Cheryl Schwartz, author, discusses her book “The Journey Out: A Guide for and About Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Teens”.
COMMERCIAL: GMHC (Gay Men’s Health Crisis), “Fight the Fear”
6. Entertainment News

7. “Lambda Update”: Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta’s interview with Catherine Hanssens, Lambda AIDS Project Director, regarding recent HIV testing proposals.
8. Lou Maletta interviews Lieutenant Grace Telesco and Police Officer Thomas Scaringelli, of the NYPD, regarding recruitment of new NYPD members.
9. Clip of “Coming Out Under Fire” documentary regarding gays in the military.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 5

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes footage of Ed Koch regarding NYC Mayor Rudy Giuliani’s treatment of Ramon Cortines.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water

2. Interview: Tom Beer, [filmmaker] with AIDS Community Television, and Kate Barnhart, activist with YELL and ACTUP, discuss Beer’s film “Peer Education, Not Fear Education”, in which Barnhart appears. Includes film clip.
COMMERCIAL: “Panic Disorder: It’s real. It’s treatable”, National Institute of Mental Health
3. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith
4. Footage of Carol Channing at [Champs].
5. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Willie Davis
COMMERCIAL: Elizabeth Taylor for AmFAR, “Don’t make it five thousand and one”
6. Clip from Tracey Ullman’s show [“Tracey Takes On…”]. Includes introduction by Andy Humm.
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A
COMMERCIAL: “A Living Memorial to the Holocaust Museum of Jewish Heritage”
7. Footage of Men of Discipline anniversary party at The Lure.
COMMERCIAL: GMHC (Gay Men’s Health Crisis), “Fight the Fear”
8. Entertainment News
9. Footage of cast of “Hello, Dolly!” performing “One Night in Heaven”.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 6

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: “Party”, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes Headline News footage regarding a custody case between a lesbian and her convicted murderer husband.
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
2. Interview: Steve Michael, Democratic Presidential Candidate, regarding his campaign.
3. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Hank Aaron
4. Footage of Rich Tafel, Executive Director of the Log Cabin Republicans, at an LCR conference regarding the rating of Republicans in Congress.
5. AIDS News
6. Lou Maletta interviews Phillip Matthews, Acting Executive Director of the People With AIDS (PWA) Coalition, regarding current HIV-related topics and issues.
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

7. “Lambda Update”: Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta’s interview with Suzanne Goldberg, Lambda Staff Attorney, regarding a Russian lesbian named Alla Pitcherskaia who is seeking political asylum in the US.
8. Entertainment News. Includes footage of Alice Walker on “Charlie Walker”.
9. Footage of “All My Children”.
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith
10. Andy Humm promotes “Virgins and Other Myths”, a one-man play by Colin Martin.
COMMERCIAL: “Party”, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
11. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Nikki Franke
COMMERCIAL: “Panic Disorder: It’s real. It’s treatable”, National Institute of Mental Health

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 7

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Currently not available for viewing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Program Content: Unknown

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 8

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes NBC footage of Pat Buchanan, Republican Presidential Candidate, speaking in Manchester.
COMMERCIAL: “Party”, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
2. Footage from CSPAN of discussion regarding same-sex marriage, hosted by the Los Angeles Freedom to Marry Coalition. Includes footage of Evan Wolfson, of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), “America Responds to AIDS”
3. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline

4. David Nimmons, Managing Director of Education at Gay Men’s Health Crisis (GMHC), and Carlos Cordero, from the [Community AIDS Prevention Activists], discuss CrossTalk, to be held at the Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, “It’s a connected world.”

5. Beatrice Dohrn, Legal Director of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta’s interview with David Buckel, Lambda Staff Attorney, regarding violence against lesbian and gay youth in schools.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, “It’s what in the world you can do”.
6. Ralph Garcia, licensed physical therapist and doctoral candidate at NYU, discusses and requests volunteers for his research regarding stroke survivors.
7. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: “Party”, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
8. Footage of Community Health Project’s “Snowball” event. Includes footage of Lee Sharmat interviewing Kim Barget, chair of “Snowball”.
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), “America Responds to AIDS”
9. Footage of [hypersexualized people and artwork].

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 9

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), “America Responds to AIDS”
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes CSPAN footage of Kenneth Bacon at Pentagon News Briefing regarding issues with “Don’t Ask/Don’t Tell”. Also includes NY1 footage of Norman Siegel, Executive Director of NYCLU (New York Civil Liberties Union), and Rudy Giuliani, NYC Mayor, regarding zoning laws that affect adult-themed businesses.
2. Footage of Bishop Walter Righter on Nightline discussing the ordaining of openly gay men.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression
3. Interview: Ann Maguire and Sal Cecere, of the Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization, discuss the upcoming St. Patrick’s Day parade.
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: “Party”, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
5. Lou Maletta interviews Robert Kobel, of the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), regarding tax issues that affect the gay community.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), “America Responds to AIDS”
6. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”

7. Footage of the Gay and Lesbian Community Services Center’s 4th annual Music and Comedy Gala. Includes footage of Karen Williams, [comic]; the Flirtations, [a capella group]; Tret Fure and Cris Williamson, [musicians]; and Nell Carter [singer/actress].
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
8. Lou Maletta interviews Doris Kloster, photographer, regarding her self-titled photobook.
COMMERCIAL: “Party”, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
COMMERCIAL: “Support Human Rights for Lesbian and Gay People”, sponsored by Professionals in Film/Video. Includes Cathay Che of GLAAD.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 10

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, “Stop paying too much for antique watches”
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes clip of Andy Humm questioning Bob Dole, Republican Presidential Candidate. Also includes clip of young Bob Dole in POW camp during WWII. Also includes clip of Steve Forbes, Republican Presidential Candidate, on 60 Minutes. Also includes footage of Andy Humm interviewing Tom Duane, NYC Council Member, during protest of Republican bigotry. Also includes interviews with Charles Gargano, [Vice Chairman of the Port Authority of NY]; Mark Green, [NYC Public Advocate]; and Fred Hochberg and Mark Aurigemma.
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
2. AIDS News. Includes footage of CNN [special] regarding how and possibly why AIDS affects different groups of people internationally.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression
3. Andy Humm interviews Chris Bauer and Doug Robinson, Candidates for NYC School Board, regarding their platforms.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, “It’s a connected world.”
4. Ralph Garcia, licensed physical therapist and doctoral candidate at NYU, discusses and requests volunteers for his research regarding stroke survivors.
5. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”

6. Footage of Gary Miller, Director, and Ann Hampton Callaway, singer, with the NYC Gay Men’s Chorus. Includes interviews with Miller and Callaway regarding the current program “With a Song in Our Heart” of Rodgers and Hart music.
7. Lou Maletta promotes Andrew Barrett and Chris Burney’s Pop Diva Taylor Dane in “Archy and Mehitabel”.
8. Lou Maletta interviews Dirk Shafer, Playgirl’s “Man of the Year”, regarding his personal life. Includes clip of Shafer’s film “Man of the Year”.
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, “Stop paying too much for antique watches”

9. “Lambda Update”: Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta’s interview with Suzanne Goldberg, Lambda Staff Attorney, regarding a recent victory in Portland, Oregon, on behalf of ACTUP protestors who had been illegally strip searched after being arrested at a demonstration.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), “America Responds to AIDS”

10. Footage of NYC Council General Welfare Committee from March 1986 discussing lesbian and gay rights bill. Includes footage of Tom Stoddard, co-author, Intro. 2; Andy Humm, gay activist; Joyce Hunger, of the NYC Human Rights Commission; and Patrick Silva, Attorney.

scopecontent.p: 1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Andy Humm and Ann Northrop at Breakfast at Gracie Mansion in Honor of Lesbian and Gay Pride Month. Includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; Matthew Sperling, Candidate for Congress, 8th District; [unnamed] from the NY Freedom to Marry Committee; Karla, of the Gay and Lesbian Immigration Rights Task Force; and Brian Steel, Candidate for Congress, 8th District.
3. Interview: Doug Sterner, President of the Gay and Lesbian Independent Democrats (GLID), discusses the organization’s lack of endorsement in the race for Manhattan Surrogate Court Judge.
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”
4. Footage of Gay and Lesbian Pride Rally at Union Square. Includes footage of Joe Gallagher, International Mr. Leather; Tom Stoddard, [activist]; and The Flirtations, a capella group.
COMMERCIAL: “Support Human Rights for Lesbian and Gay People”, sponsored by Professionals in Film/Video. Includes Cathay Che of GLAAD.
5. AIDS News. Includes footage of Lou Maletta interviewing Dr. William Paul, Director of the National Office of AIDS Research.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, “It’s a connected world.”
6. Footage of 3rd annual Public Advocate Lesbian and Gay Awards. Includes footage of Mark Green, Public Advocate; Ann Northrop, honoree; and Carol Channing, honoree.
7. Entertainment News
8. Interview: Robert Gomes discusses the film “The Rock”. Includes film footage.
9. Lou Maletta interviews Eric Wolf, organizer of the 12 Gods Party, regarding the event.
COMMERCIAL: 12 Gods Party

10. Footage of the Thirteenth Annual Garden Party held by the Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center. Includes footage of the Flirtations, a capella group; Kate Clinton, comedienne; and Jimmy James, [performer].
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”
11. Lou Maletta interviews Lea DeLaria, comedienne, regarding her one-night show at [Caroline’s].
12. Lou Maletta urges viewers to pledge money to Gay Cable Network.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Footage of Long Beach Pride.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine

2. Footage from CSPAN of US House of Representatives voting on a bill to define marriage and allow states not to recognize same-sex marriage. Includes footage of Martin Meehan, Democratic Representative from Massachusetts; Tom DeLay, Republican Representative from Texas/Republican Whip; Sam Gejdenson, Democratic Representative from Connecticut; George Gekas, Republican Representative from Pennsylvania; and David Funderburk, Republican Representative from North Carolina.
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
COMMERCIAL: “Support Human Rights for Lesbian and Gay People”, sponsored by Professionals in Film/Video. Includes Cathay Che of GLAAD.

3. Additional footage from CSPAN of US House of Representatives voting on a bill to define marriage and allow states not to recognize same-sex marriage. Includes footage of Charles Canady, Republican Representative from Florida; Wayne Gilchrest, Republican Representative from Maryland; Bob Barr, Republican Representative from Georgia; Cliff Stearns, Republican Representative from Florida; Robert Dornan, Republican Representative from California; Ron Lewis, Republican Representative from Kentucky; Neil Abercrombie, Democratic Representative from Hawaii; and Ed Bryant, Republican Representative from Tennessee.
COMMERCIAL: National Association of People with AIDS, “Don’t wait. Take the test for HIV. Take control.”
COMMERCIAL: Children’s Hope Foundation
4. Footage of California AIDS Ride 3. Includes footage of San Francisco Mayor Willie Brown; Judith Light, [actress]; and Daniel Pallotta, creator of AIDS Ride 3.
COMMERCIAL: Static
5. Footage of Bastille Day, celebrated with Restaurant Florent. Includes footage of Lou Maletta interviewing Florent Morellet, Grande Hostess.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”

6. “Lambda Update”: Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta’s interview with Beatrice Dohrn, Lambda Legal Director, regarding the gay community’s victory in the Colorado Amendment 2 case.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Academy for State and Local Government, “Be a hero to a child in your community”
7. Lou Maletta interviews Brad Gooch, author, regarding his book “The Golden Age of Promiscuity”.
COMMERCIAL: 12 Gods Party
8. Lou Maletta discusses the material covered in this episode.

4. Footage of “Mad Elephants – The 1992 Republican National Convention”. Includes footage of various unnamed Republican Delegates; Phil Gramm, Senator; Phyllis Schlafly, Republican Delegate; Robert Dornan, Congressman; and Strom Thurmond, Senator.

5. Footage of ACTUP March to the Houston Astrodome and additional footage of [Mad Elephants - 1992 Republican National Convention]. Includes footage of various unnamed Republican Delegates; Mary Fisher, HIV-positive Keynote Speaker; Steven Bradley, HIV-positive reporter; Patrick Buchanan, politician; Rev. Lou Sheldon, of the Traditional Values Coalition; Rev. Pat Robertson, Christian Broadcasting; Newt Gingrich, Congressman; Guy Hunt, Alabama Governor; and Beth Leibo, GCN Correspondent.

Brent Bozell, conservative columnist; Barbara Bateman, Ohio Delegate; Mary Fisher, PWA (People With AIDS) Speaker; and Strom Thurmond, Senator from South Carolina.

Includes interviews with Arianna Huffington, [commentator]; Gary Bauer, of the Family Research Council; Dick Armey, Representative from Texas, House Majority Leader; and George Pataki, Governor of NY.

COMMERCIAL: 12 Gods Party

4. Footage of Ann Northrop outside the 1996 Republican National Convention, where advocacy groups were protesting. Includes footage of Melinda Paras, Executive Director of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force (NGLTF), and Eric Rofes, gay activist.
COMMERCIAL: Confide, HIV Testing Service

5. Footage of GCN correspondents Ed Anderson and Ann Northrop outside the 1996 Republican National Convention, where advocacy groups were protesting. Includes footage of Nicole Ramirez Murray, gay activist; Derek Hodel, of GMHC (Gay Men’s Health Crisis), “Condom Man”; David Smith, of the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); Melinda Paras, Executive Director of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force (NGLTF); Candace Gingrich, of the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); Ralph Reed of the Christian Coalition; and Al Franken, of Comedy Central.

Includes footage of Elizabeth Birch, Executive Director of the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); Paul Simon, Democratic Senator from Illinois; Frank Lautenberg, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Ron Wyden, Democratic Senator from Oregon; Daniel Moynihan, Democratic Senator from New York; Jay Rockefeller; Democratic Senator from West Virginia; Byron Dorgan, Democratic Senator from North Dakota; Charles Robb, Democratic Senator from Virginia; Bill Bradley, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Carl Levin, Democratic Senator from Michigan; Tom Harkin, Democratic Senator from Iowa; and Howell Heflin, Democratic Senator from Alabama.

scopecontent.p: 1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes footage of Ann Northrop and [Michelangelo Signorile] at event for Barbara Mikulski, Senator, regarding her support of the Defense of Marriage Act (DOMA). Also includes CNN coverage of trial of Jonathan Schmitz, who murdered a gay acquaintance named Scott Amedure, who had revealed his crush on Schmitz during an episode of ‘The Jenny Jones Show”.

COMMERCIAL: GMHC (Gay Men’s health Crisis), “Help us help.”

6. Footage of town meeting on same-sex marriage. Includes footage of Rev. Pat Bumgardner, of MCCNY (Metropolitan Community Church of NY), and Ann Northrop.
7. Entertainment News. Includes clip of the film “Braveheart”.

did.unittitle: 1997 Vol. XV
Gay USA, Vol. XV, Episode No. 1

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: “Gay Year in Review – 1996” (Clips from this episode are pulled from previous episodes from 1996; some have been slightly edited.)

1. Footage of Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat at St. Patrick’s Day parade, which includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; William Donahue, of the Catholic League for Religious and Civil Rights; Ed Sullivan, of the NYS Assembly; Louis Anemone, Chief of Department, NYPD; Cardinal John Joseph O’Connor, “Archbigot” of NY; Rudy Giuliani, NYC Mayor; William Bratton, NYC Police Commissioner; Ed Koch, former NYC Mayor; and Al D’Amato, US Senator.
2. Footage of GLAAD Media Awards. Includes footage of Robert Wooley, auctioneer; Raquel Welch, actress; Barbara Walters, journalist; and Ru Paul, drag queen.
3. Footage of Lee Sharmat at Night of 1000 Gowns.
COMMERCIAL: Static
COMMERCIAL: Condomania, “Dress the part”

4. Footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Democratic National Convention. Includes footage of Paul Simon, Democratic Senator from Illinois; Frank Lautenberg, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Ron Wyden, Democratic Senator from Oregon; Daniel Moynihan, Democratic Senator from New York; Jay Rockefeller; Democratic Senator from West Virginia; Byron Dorgan, Democratic Senator from North Dakota; Charles Robb, Democratic Senator from Virginia; Bill Bradley, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Carl Levin, Democratic Senator from Michigan; and Howell Heflin, Democratic Senator from Alabama.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”
COMMERCIAL: Condomania, “Induce penis envy”

5. Andy Humm discusses the Colorado Amendment 2 court decision. Includes interviews with Suzanne Goldberg, Staff Attorney for Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund; Tom Stoddard, veteran gay activist; and Deborah Glick, of the NYS Assembly.

6. Andy Humm discusses the Hawaii same-sex marriage case. Includes interviews with Evan Wolfson, [Staff Attorney for] Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, and Co-Counsel in the Hawaii same-sex marriage case; Jerry Nadler, of the US Congress; and members of the general public. Also includes footage of Rudy Giuliani, NYC Mayor; Tom DeLay, Representative from Texas/Republican Whip; Sam Gejdenson, Democratic Representative from Connecticut; Gerry Studds, Democratic Representative from Massachusetts; Steve Gunderson, Republican Representative from Wisconsin; Barney Frank; Democrat with the Subcommittee on the Constitution of the Judiciary Committee; and Henry Hyde, Republican Representative from Illinois/Judiciary Committee Chairman.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, “The one. The only. The original.”
COMMERCIAL: Condomania, “Make it part of your routine”

7. Footage of “The Great Wed-In” at Bryant Park. Includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; Gloria Steinem, activist; William Wynkoop and Roy Strickland; Connie and Dorothy Danaher; and Tori Watson and Scott Blankenship.
8. Footage of 1996 Gay and Lesbian Pride March.
9. Footage of Dyke March. Includes Lee Sharmat interviewing Kim Barget.
10. Clip of “The Ambiguously Gay Duo” sketch from The Dana Carvey Show.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Footage of David Partridge at the “We Are Family Too” picnic in West Village.
2. Footage of the Mr. Northeast Drummer contest at the Lure, NYC.
3. Footage of the Tom of Finland party at the Sound Factory, NYC.
COMMERCIAL: SAGE (Senior Action in a Gay Environment)
4. Footage of Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat at the Garden Party for the Gay and Lesbian Community Services Center. Includes interview with Deborah Glick, Candidate for Manhattan Borough President.
5. Footage of Mothers’ March Candlelight Vigil
6. Interview: C. Virginia Fields, Candidate for Manhattan Borough President, discusses her political history and platform.
7. Interview: Richard Laermer, author, discusses his book “Get On with It: The Gay and Lesbian Guide to Getting Online”.
COMMERCIAL: SAGE (Senior Action in a Gay Environment)
8. Footage of 28th annual gay and lesbian pride march.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XV, Episode No. 38, Time Warner New York City
[Air date: 10/2/1997]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), “The one. The only. The original.”
1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: SAGE (Senior Action in a Gay Environment)

2. Interview: Edgar Rodriguez, President of the Gay Officers Action League (GOAL), discusses the incident in which a fellow cop returned a medal awarded to him by Rodriguez, and then made offensive homophobic remarks to Rodriguez.
3. Interview: Tina Machinda, Chairperson of Gays and Lesbians of Zimbabwe (GALZ), discusses the rights of homosexuals in Zimbabwe.
4. AIDS News
5. Interview: Riki Anne Wilchins, Executive Director of GenderPAC and author, discusses her book “Read My Lips: Sexual Subversion and the End of Gender”.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water
6. Per Larson, author of “Gay Money”, discusses what happens financially when people are in their 20s.
7. Entertainment
COMMERCIAL: SAGE (Senior Action in a Gay Environment)
8. Nora Burns discusses nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A
COMMERCIAL: “A Living Memorial to the Holocaust Museum of Jewish Heritage”
9. Lou Maletta interviews Dan Anderson, author, regarding his book “Sex Tips For Straight Women from a Gay Man”.
COMMERCIAL: GMHC (Gay Men’s Health Crisis), “Fight the Fear”
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XV, Episode No. 40, Time Warner New York City
[Air date: 10/16/1997]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), “The one. The only. The original.”
1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: SAGE (Senior Action in a Gay Environment)
2. Jesus Lebron and Gary Lawman, of Gay and Lesbian Advocates for Change, promote a rally in support of Ruth Messinger for NYC Mayor.
COMMERCIAL: Cable Positive, “AIDS is not over”

3. “Lambda Update”: Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Jennifer Pizer, Western Regional Office Managing Attorney, and Jane Morrison, Southern Regional Office Managing Attorney, who discuss Lambda’s domestic partnership work nationwide.
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline
5. Interview: Robert D. Zimmerman, author, discusses his book “Hostage”.
COMMERCIAL: CDC National AIDS Hotline, PSA for providing food for homebound people with AIDS
6. “Here’s to Our Health: Lesbian and Gay Health Concerns”: Timm Sharbaugh discusses AIDS statistics and news.
7. Entertainment
8. Promo for PBS show “In the Life”
9. Per Larson, author of “Gay Money”, discusses what happens financially when people are in their 30s.
10. Clip from upcoming HBO “Intimate Portrait” episode featuring Dr. Susan Love, a lesbian breast cancer specialist and adoptive mother.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XV, Episode No. 41, Time Warner New York City
[Air date: 10/23/1997]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), “The one. The only. The original.”
1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: SAGE (Senior Action in a Gay Environment)
2. Interview: Paula Ettelbrick, Legislative Director of the Empire State Pride Agenda, discusses ESPA’s decision to remain neutral in the NYC Mayoral race between Ruth Messinger and Rudolph Giuliani.
COMMERCIAL: CDC National AIDS Hotline, PSA for providing food for homebound people with AIDS
3. Jesus Lebron and Gary Lawman, of Gay and Lesbian Advocates for Change, promote multiple rallies in support of Ruth Messinger for NYC Mayor.
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: Elizabeth Taylor for AmFAR, “Don’t make it five thousand and one”
5. “Here’s to Our Health: Lesbian and Gay Health Concerns”: Timm Sharbaugh discusses the bacteria campylobacter, which can cause bowel problems.
6. Entertainment
7. Per Larson, author of “Gay Money”, discusses what happens financially when people are in their 40s.
COMMERCIAL: CDC National Aids Hotline, “When I Grow Up”
8. Footage of contest at The Eagle, in celebration of their 27th anniversary.

4. Interview: Deborah Glick, NYS Assembly Member, discusses political issues affecting the LGBT community.
5. Footage of Andy Humm interviewing Eric Sawyer of AIDS Drugs for Africa and ACT UP at a George W. Bush protest.
6. Entertainment
7. Interview: Deborah Glick, NYS Assembly Member, continues her discussion of political issues affecting the LGBT community.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. [40]
[Air date: 10/14/1999]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
2. Footage of Bill Clinton at the Empire State Pride Agenda dinner discussing political issues affecting the LGBT community.
3. Footage of Andy Humm interviewing attendees at the Empire State Pride Agenda dinner.
4. Lesbian and Gay News
5. Interview: Howie Katz, Director of the New York regional office of the Anti-Defamation League, discusses hate crimes legislation.
6. AIDS News
7. Interview: John Catania and Desireena Almoradie, Producers of “In the Life”, discuss the evolution and significance of their show.
8. Entertainment
9. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.
10. Clip from “Queer As Folk” of two gay men kissing; Lou Maletta discusses the significance of this clip.

did.unittitle:

[Air date: 10/21/1999]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
2. Footage from C-SPAN of Janet Reno, Attorney General, at the Human Rights Campaign Annual Dinner discussing hate crimes.
3. Footage from C-SPAN of Judy Shepard, mother of Matthew Shepard, at the Human Rights Campaign Annual Dinner. Includes Human Rights Campaign commercial featuring Judy Shepard.
4. Footage from C-Span of Martina Navratilova, civil rights activist and former professional tennis player, at the Human Rights Campaign Annual Dinner, receiving the National Equality Award.
5. AIDS News
6. Entertainment
7. Lou Maletta discusses male and female reproductive systems.
8. Footage from Matthew Shepard political funeral.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XVIII, Episode No. 6
[Air date: 2/10/2000]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival

COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival
5. Entertainment
6. Clip from Monika Treut’s film “Gendernauts”.

7. Lou Maletta discusses his upcoming presentation at the Community Center regarding the history and importance of gay cable. Maletta also mentions that they have 6000 videos in their archive which will be digitized and eventually put on the Internet for people to see.

did.unittitle: Series XXII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
"Pride and Progress" is described as "a half hour of news, community affairs, health reports, and sports documenting the pride and progress of gay men and women nationally."
"The Right Stuff" spotlights "gay talent, events, and happenings for and about the gay community."
Air date and volume number drawn from "GCN Archives Inventory" Binder, or container annotations

did.unittitle: Subseries A: Cablecast Programs

[1]--Pride and Progress. Episode No. 1 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 118
[Air Date: 10/4/1984]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Massachusetts Congressman Gary Studds, openly gay, wins primary victory; Interview with David Bender of the Studds campaign
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
2. Sports report
3. Federal government requests AIDS funding
4. Rutgers University offers "Homosexuality in Society" course
5. FBI files on gay organizations released
6. Referendum to repeal gay rights in Maryland
7. Human Rights Commission: gay and lesbian discrimination documentation project; interview with Katy Taylor
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native"
8. Three teens charged in death of Charles Howard, a gay man in Maine
9. Interview with Vivian Shapiro, Human Rights Campaign
COMMERCIAL: "The Connect"
Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Steven Caiazza discusses "How to Reduce Risk of Getting AIDS"
COMMERCIAL: World of Video

The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
COMMERCIAL: Pensione, San Francisco Hotel
1. Interview with Phyllis Diller, entertainer
COMMERCIAL: H. Clay Friedrichs Realtors, New Jersey
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
2."Brothers," a Showtime cable comedy series
COMMERCIAL: "People in Touch," a gay dating service
3. "Fever of an Unknown Origin" - Interviews with actor playwright Stephen Holt, actor Raymie Priesmeyer, scenes from the play
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
COMMERCIAL: Spur Productions
4. Phyllis Diller interview/ closing credits
COMMERCIAL National Fund for Human Dignity with Judge Steven Lax

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Sentencing of Maine teens in death of Charles Howard, a gay man
2. San Francisco rejects extending employment benefits to gay partners of city workers
3. First Ronald Reagan versus Walter Mondale debate viewed by gay Mondale supporters
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
4. Sports Report
5. Interview with Ivan [Deeds] about Gay Narcotics Anonymous
6. Sweden as a place for political asylum for gays
7. Sentencing of Gary Lee Hopper, a male hustler, in slashing and attempted robbery of gay man
8. Gay center opens in Allentown, Pennsylvania
9. Interview with Peter Vogel, Chairperson for New York Gay Task Force
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
10. Interview with Peter Guardino, Gay Police Officers Action League
11. Proposal to make West Hollywood a city
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native"
Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Scott Croxson, Fellow Immunopathology, discusses HTLV virus
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," a gay newspaper

The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Mike Farrell
1. Footage from San Francisco memorial for John Simms, who passed away from AIDS
COMMERCIAL: H. Clay Friedrichs Realtors, New Jersey
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
2.Interview with director Robert Epstein, producer Richard Schmiechen, and publicist Vito Russo, "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: Pensione, San Francisco Hotel
COMMERCIAL: Spur Productions
3. "Swan in Love," commentary and clips about motion picture
COMMERCIAL National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Jack Albertson
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
4. More from interviews about "The Times of Harvey Milk"/ closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 123

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. New York Executive Order #50 - a non-discrimination policy on city contactors
2. Interview with Willy Smith, Gay and Lesbian Inter-Religious Coalition
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native," with Quentin Crisp
3. Interview with Nancy Roth, executive director of Gay Rights National Lobby, Washington D.C.
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, Career Service Professionals
4. AIDS fears in court
5. Interview with Tim Sweeney, director of LAMBDA Legal Defense, discussing LAMBDA's AIDS Legal Guide
COMMERCIAL: "Rome Adventure," Orpheo Travel Agency
6. Interview with Reverend Karen Zeigler, director of Metropolitan Community Church, discussing their on-going application to the National Council of Churches
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
7. Gay and lesbian child custody announcement
8. LAMBDA Democrats, authors night
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos Resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
9. Heathline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Jeffrey Lawrence, NY Hospital, Cornell Medical Center, discusses new directions in treating AIDS
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
10. Sports Report: Interview with Jim Link and Leslie Randolph, Rambler Soccer Club

The Right Stuff:
1. 1984 Halloween on Christopher Street, NYC
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay/lesbian newspaper
2. Lo Nardo, music group, performing
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
3. Broadway star Vivian Blaine performing "live" at SAGE Benefit at the Limelight, NYC. Songs: "Guys and Dolls medley"
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
4. Media Report: "Hollywood Babylon II," Japanese condoms, Cardinal Spellman, Michael Musto receives Village Voice column
COMMERCIAL: Spur Production
5. 1984 Halloween coverage/ Closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Interview with Nancy Roth, Executive Director, Gay Rights National Lobby, discussing anti-discrimination in immigration policy
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. City status granted to West Hollywood, California; city council is formed
3. Anti-gay Texas Senator Phil [Graham] wins election
4. Gay Rights bill passed in Houston, Texas, but may be overturned
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
5. Interview with David Bender, campaigner, discussing the win of Massachusetts' openly gay Senator Gary Studds
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay Film Festival
6. National Gay Task Force meeting
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Interview with Pastor Karen Zeigler, Metropolitan Community Church, discusses meeting with National Council of Churches
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
8. First census of a gay community, San Francisco
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
9. Carol Bellamy, announcement of upcoming appearance
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos, San Juan, Puerto Rico
10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Christopher Collins, attorney, discusses the start of Community Health Project
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," a NYC gay bar
11. Sports Report/ closing

The Right Stuff:
1. Media Report/ Current Events
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. Terry Miller interviews Quentin Crisp, author/ performer
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
3. Quentin Crisp interview continued
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity for disabled gays and lesbians
4. Preview of upcoming gay motion picture, "Whispers"
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
5. Interview with Ron Gould, producer of gay film "Whispers"/ closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. "Black and White Men Together" members Lidell Jackson and Mitchell Karp discuss racial discrimination at the Ice Palace
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
2. National Gay Task Force, interviews with members Peter Fowler and Evelyn White
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
3. Interview with Keith O'Connor, NYC Human Rights Commission, discussing anti-gay discrimination bill in NYC
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janiero, The Islanders Club
4. Report on Executive Order 50; employment rights for city contractors
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay Film Festival
5. U.S. Court of Appeals for District of Columbia refused to hear case of expelled gay navy officer
6. Community announcements
COMMERCIAL: Arco Blancos resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
7. Heathline: Conversations with GMHC: Topic: AIDS Assessment Program of Community Health Project. Interview with Dr. Ted Lazarus, clinical coordinator AIDS Assessment Program, and Rona Affoumado, Admin. Director, Community Health Project
COMMERCIAL: Badlands, NYC gay bar
8. Sports report

The Right Stuff:
1. Current Events
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
2. Interview with Gary Miller, music director of the NYC Gay Men's Chorus, includes footage of chorus performing at Christopher Street Liberation Day Parade 1984
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay and Lesbian Film Festival
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity: gay and lesbian disabled
4. Interview with Quentin Crisp

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:

COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
2. [Greg Merkus] discusses upcoming Winter Solstice fundraiser at the new Community Center
3. Dr. Mervin Silverman talks to New York Physicians For Human Rights discussing his concerns over the re-opening of bathhouses in San Francisco
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
4. "Black and White Men Together" members Lidell Jackson and Mitchell Karp discuss racial discrimination
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
5. Keith O'Connor, NYC Human Rights Commission, discusses gay discrimination
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janiero, The Islanders Club
6. Judges decision in the Dronenberg case challenges right to privacy
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford
7. Report on the test for HTLV and fears of misuse
COMMERCIAL: Arco Blancos resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico

COMMERCIAL: Badlands, NYC gay bar

COMMERCIAL: World of Video
10. Current Events

GCN Special Presentation: "Whispers," a gay docudrama
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
1. "Whispers," a gay docudrama
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 130
[Air Date: 12/26/1984]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. A recap of some of the major LGBT events of 1984. Clips include:
2. Original "Stonewallers" at Pride Parade
3. Bella Abzug speech at Greater Gotham Business Meeting
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Virginia Apuzzo on LGBT presence at Democratic National Convention
5. VP candidate Geraldine Ferraro at Democratic National Convention on human rights
6. Maureen Reagan, daughter of President, interviewed at Republican National Convention
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
7. Mayor Ed Koch at fundraiser for Judge Bill Thom
8. David Rothenberg campaign speech
10. Speech by Victor Gotbaum, Director DC 37, AFSCME
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
11. [Fairpack], a new political gay action committee
12. Reports on AIDS in 1984
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
13. Report on gays on television in 1984, including Showtime's cable series "Brothers"
14. Gay youth
16. Acquisition of NYC's LGBT Community Center on West 13th Street
15. Wrap up of 1984 events
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
16. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Michael Shernoff, Chelsea Psychotherapy, discusses how to deal with friends who have AIDS
17. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Performance by the Big Apple Corps Band with the Pink Panther
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford
2. Gary Dee, female impersonator, on playing Joan Rivers
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
3. "Home for the Holidays," benefit at Limelight for AIDS Research Center (ARC), appearances by Whoopi Goldberg, Maurice Hines
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
4. "Impulse," Gat TV in Atlanta
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
5. Closing Credits

COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
6. Latest on gays and religion
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
7. Reagan administration may strike down current immigration laws that prevent gays from entering U.S.
8. Berkeley, California extends domestic partner benefits to city employees
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store

COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
10. Sports Report/ Closing

COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club

COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Gary Dee, female impersonator, on playing Joan Rivers
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
4. Interview with film director Reinhard von der Marwitz, discusses "Giarres"
COMMERCIAL: Actor/ playwright Harvey Fierstein announces his return to "Torch Song Trilogy" at the Helen Hayes Theatre
5. "Fame" clips/ closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Virginia Apuzzo resigns from National Gay Task Force
2. Virginia Apuzzo gives speech at press conference
COMMERCIAL: Actor/ playwright Harvey Fierstein announces his return to "Torch Song Trilogy" at the Helen Hayes Theatre
3. Reagan administration drastically cuts AIDS funding in 1986 budget
4. French researchers develop new drug for AIDS treatment, HPA23
4. ABC movie "Consulting Adults", viewership ratings and clip from film
5. New Hampshire Bill proposes gay/lesbian blood donation as felony
6. School administrators cancel Tolerance Day in Madison, Maine, because of lesbian speaker
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Commentary on LGBT civil rights
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
8. Texas State Legislature representative Bill Ceverha, author of proposed Texas sodomy law
9. West Hollywood and domestic partners ordinance
10. San Francisco City Civil Service Commission rejects Public Health department request to hire private investigators for gay bathhouses
11. "The Times of Harvey Milk" documentary acclaim
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
12. Sports
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Michele Schwartz, Coordinator of Senior Action in a Gay Environment
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Sue Cavin, president of the Gay and Lesbian Press Association, discusses censorship in the New York Times
2. Media reports/current events/culture
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Sybil Opthalmia Bruncheon takes ill
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
4. Cooking with Sybil Opthalmia Bruncheon
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Jack Albertson
5. Closing credits

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. HTLV testing delay and false positive rate
2. Gerry Studds regains chairmanship of the house subcommittee on coastguard and navigation
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
3. Kings County Council in Washington state proposes an updated anti-gay discrimination ban for employment
4. More on West Hollywood and domestic partners ordinance
5. More on school administrators cancel Tolerance Day in Madison, Maine, because of lesbian speaker
6. Commentary on Bernard Goetz, "subway vigilante"
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Los Angeles Mayor Tom Bradley fails to appoint more high level positions to openly gay people and promises to do better if re-elected
8. Councilman John Goodner of Houston, Texas plans to challenge current pro-gay mayor, Kathy Whitmire
9. Sue Lovell becomes first female president of Houston's Gay Political caucus
10. Erie, Pennsylvania Judge questions validity of gay man's will, specifies nearly 120,000 dollar donation to further gay civil rights
10. Big Brother accepts any volunteers no matter his/her sexual orientation
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
11. Sports, interview with Tom Hull, commissioner of MCAA Big Apple Softball
12. Weather report
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Sara T. Beatrice, Chief of Virology Labs, New York City Department of Health, discusses HTLV 3 test
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
2. "Rags of the 80s" Fashion show footage at The Limelight
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Interview with Dr. Jim Serafini on counseling both straight and gay men
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
4. Interview with William Hoffman and Marshall Mason, playwright and director of play "As Is"
5. Closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Update on Human Rights Commission documenting anti-gay discrimination
2. Interview with Keith O'Connor, Director of Discrimination for the NYC Human Rights Commission
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
3. Supreme court refuses to hear Ohio high school guidance counselor's gay discrimination case
4. National Gay Task Force Versus Oklahoma City schools
5. Baltimore city council members vote against gay civil rights (anti-discriminatory) law
6. Carol Bellamy, President of the New York City council, runs for mayor, includes clip of Bellamy at Greater Gotham Business Council
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. The Foundation For Traditional Morality blames rise in AIDS to overturned Dallas sodomy law
8. Local Dallas insurance agent misrepresents cancer plan to bar owners, says it includes AIDS, AIDS insurance plans
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
9. Washing D.C. gay activists ask city to help fund AIDS education, counseling, and services
10. Reagan administration lacks AIDS funding support
11. Inter-faith Forum clip on Religion and AIDS
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
12. Sports
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Christopher Collins, Cooperating Attorney with LAMBDA Legal Defense and Education Fund, discusses HTLVIII test
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture including Reagan rap and "Pleasure Beach" clip
[COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"]
2. Barbara Esposito and Bruce Hopkins start gay comedy night at Paper Moon, clips and outtakes
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Interview with psychologist, Dr. Jim Serafini, discusses AIDS and sex fears

Pride and Progress

COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
3. Mariposa Foundation's Bruce Vogler discovers spermicide that eliminates HTLVIII on contact
4. Update on Supreme Court cases, National Gay Task Force Versus Oklahoma City schools
5. Interview with Tom Stoddard Legislative Director of New York Civil Liberties Union, discusses gay civil rights and Supreme Court cases
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
6. Future of gay civil rights
7. Anti-gay violence/harassment in Texas
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Mike Farrell
8. Minneapolis gym owner closes his business rather than abide by city's gay ordinances
9. Zelda Rubinstein works for Los Angeles AIDS education group, appears on posters and ads, includes clip from "Poltergeist"
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
10. Sports
11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Christopher Collins, Cooperating Attorney with LAMBDA Legal Defense and Education Fund, returns and discusses HTLVIII test
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture including Sammy Davis Junior clip and CBS HTVLIII coverage
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
2. Restaurant review
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Sybil Bruncheon

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 183
[Air Date: 2/10/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Leader of recent Southern Baptist Convention speaks out against gays
2. Ms. Magazine names two friends of the gay community, Lilly Timbaland and Doctor Mathilde Krim, as its Women of the Year
3. Minnesota woman fighting to care for severely disabled lover
4. Coors beer boycotts due to anti-gay practices
COMMERCIAL: Sears
5. Lesbian and Gay Rights Bill
6. Jim Levin, New York City Commissioner of Human Rights, discusses proposal
7. Tom Stoddard, Executive Director of LAMBDA Legal Defense, discusses Georgia Sodomy Law updates
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
8. Pennsylvania Department of Health registries
9. Florida legislature tries to make HTLVIII test mandatory for state teachers and students
10. Pennsylvania gay activists and Department of Health safety pamphlet
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
11. Sports, includes clip
12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Sara Mercado, loses son to AIDS, discusses AIDS care and her experiences
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Sybil Bruncheon, Valentine's Day
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Sybil Bruncheon's birthday
COMMERCIAL: Sybil Bruncheon T-Shirts
4. Sybil returns and love scenes
COMMERCIAL: CASIO Pocket TV
5. Current events, interview with Debbie Provenzanio, cuts off

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 8 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 184
[Air Date: 2/19/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Georgetown University The Human Rights Commission
2. New San Francisco "poppers" legislation
3. Gay man wins case, kills man in self defense after a year of harassment and physical abuse
4. Gay and lesbian counseling service and United Liquors seventeen thousand dollar grant
5. Jim Flint, President of Prairie State Democratic Club, announces entrance into Democratic Primary as Cook County Commissioner
6. "How to Lobby your Legislature" part two with Jim Levin, New York City Human Rights Commissioner
COMMERCIAL: CASIO Pocket TV
7. San Francisco Health Department Task Force recommends abortions for pregnant women with AIDS
8. Seramin does not treat AIDS
9. New York hospital faces heavy penalties for mistreating persons with AIDS
10. Job discrimination and AIDS
11. Atlanta Man sets computer to call right winged conservative Jerry Falwell's toll free number every thirty seconds for eight months after anti-gay remarks, each call cost two dollars
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Robert Bolton, volunteer on GMHC hotline, discusses involvement in program
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby, includes clip
2. Sybil Bruncheon opens present
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Sybil and hats
COMMERCIAL: Sybil Bruncheon T-Shirts
4. Books Reviews: Malcolm Boyd's "Half Laughing, Half Crying" and Howard Cruse's "Wendel"
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
5. Current events/media/culture, includes sitcom clip and news coverage

[Air Date: 3/12/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. National Gay Rights Advocates, Bowers versus Hardwick in United States Supreme Court
2. Two openly gay candidates run for office in Dane County, Wisconsin
3. Megatone Records manager pleads guilty to embezzling fourteen thousand dollars from Gay Men's Health crisis proceeds
4. Austin, Texas Klu Klux Klan member lashes out against homosexuals
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
5. Boston College anti-gay discrimination
6. Jack Campbell runs for Florida United States Senate
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Cambridge University treats AIDS patients with HTLVIII antibody blood
8. Two labs develop possible HTLVIII vaccine advances
9. Report examines HTLVIII credibility
10. Pennsylvania bill proposes HTLVIII positive marriage ban
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
11. Sports, includes clips
12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Doris Traussig, GMHC volunteer, discusses what she does and why she volunteers
13. screening of "A Chance of a Lifetime" at Hunter College
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby, includes clip
COMMERCIAL: CASIO Pocket TV
3. Cable Car Awards coverage
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with Mike Farrell
4. Sybil Bruncheon's birthday party
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
5. Current events/media/culture

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 12 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 188
[Air Date: 3/19/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. United States government and the HTLVIII antibody test
2. United States republican representative William Dannemeyer withdraws from senate race
3. Wisconsin assembly defeats amendment
4. Gay and lesbian couples survey
5. Andy Humm speaks to New York City Council
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
6. Atlanta Gay Center protest
7. The New York City Gay Rights Bill, includes coverage of Mayor Koch, Andy Humm, Councilman Noah Dear, Harvey Firestein
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
8. Barbara Streisand purchases play, "The Normal Heart," plans to adapt into film
9. Breast cancer more prevalent in childless women, health precautions
10. The American Foundation for AIDS Research begins fifteen more public services
11.Houston, Texas, first national hospital for AIDS treatment
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
12. Sports, interview with Ron Crispo
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Robert Isaacs, Psychotherapist, discusses drug addiction and AIDS
14. screening of "A Chance of a Lifetime" at Hunter College
15. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby, includes clip
COMMERCIAL: CASIO Pocket TV
2. Sybil Bruncheon opens more presents and intros the monster
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Sybil attempts to cook with Joseph Viane
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
4. Sybil returns
5. Current events/media/culture, includes clip
6. Robert Reilly, Author of the God of Mirrors, discusses his book

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 189
[Air Date: 3/26/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. National Security Agency agrees to a reinstate gay and bisexual men in agency
2. Minneapolis, health club owner faces daily three hundred dollar fine for unfair hiring policies, only hires fundamentalist Christians
3. Baltimore, Maryland gay activists band together for gay civil rights, Anti Discrimination Fund
4. Moral majority leader Jerry Falwell responds to phone harassment with new number
5. Andy Humm speaks in City Hall Rally, March 18th, 1986, coverage and interview
COMMERCIAL: CASIO Pocket TV
6. Minnesotan gay Air Force Pilot takes military to court for his discharge
7. Gay teachers fight homophobia in Idaho
8. Brown University sponsors conference for five hundred northeastern college students, conference focuses on efficient ways to run gay campus groups and community outreach
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
9. Minneapolis, Minnesota government pledges job security to any citizen with AIDS
10. Venereal warts
10. National Jewish AIDS Project
11. National AIDS Network starts in Washington, D.C.
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
12. Sports, Bill Baumer interviews Gay Pool League
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Sara Mercado, loses son to AIDS, discusses AIDS care and her experiences
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
2. Julie Curtis coverage of "Don't Tell Mamma"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
3. GCN Book Review: Quentin Crisp's Manners From Heaven and How to Become a Virgin
4. Sybil Bruncheon with Joseph Viane
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
5. Sybil and Joseph return, cuts off

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

Pride and Progress

COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
3. April Fools' News Stories, Continued
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Sports Report
5. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Jim Holmes discusses the safety pin as an sign of the wearer's utilization of safer sex practices
6. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:

COMMERCIAL: Casio Pocket TV
2. Sybil Bruncheon show introduction
COMMERCIAL: The Monster

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 16 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 192
[Air Date: 4/16/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. American insurance associations donate $1.1 million to AIDS research
2. Estate of Rock Hudson sues Hudson's alleged ex-lover, Marc Christian
3. Gay and Lesbian Task Force co-director, Rosemary Kuropat, resigns
4. Coverage of Bowers v Hardwick
5. Idaho attempted to introduce a bill to prohibit teachers from discussing homosexuality in a positive light
6. Oklahoma's sodomy law ruled unconstitutional but only regarding non-gay sex
7. Outing closeted homosexuals who are publically anti-gay
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
8. New Jersey wishes for Gay Rights Bill similar to New York City's
9. Gay Health Report
10. Discussion of apartment leases after AIDS-related deaths
11. Event announcement
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
12. Sports Report
13. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Joseph Foulon, a GMHC Hotline assistant, member of PWA Coalition, and an organizer of the NYC AIDS walk
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: E-Z Trim exercise equipment
2. Interview with Jaime Humberto Hermosillo and Marco Antonio Treviño, director and star of "Dona Herlinda and her Son"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
3. Pop and Circumstance: music news, video clips
4. Sybil Bruncheon, tidbits
COMMERCIAL: The Monster

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 17 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 193
[Air Date: 4/23/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Catholic theologian Charles Curran warned by Vatican for support of homosexuals
2. Sacramento city passes Gay Rights Bill
3. Indiana legislature kills several anti-gay bills
4. Fundraiser held to repeal the Texas sodomy law
5. Possible AIDS vaccine's effect on search for a cure
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
6. Rules governing the election of delegates in 1988 Democratic Convention changed to specifically include gays
7. Vermont rejects anti-discrimination move against gays by landlords
8. Gay Health Report: Study on course of HTLV infection, oral sex's riskiness, accommodation for gays visiting an Australia regatta
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
9. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Stash Santoro discusses GMHC's buddy program for those dying of AIDS
10. Sports Report, from Bowlmor Lanes
11. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: E-Z trim exercise equipment
2. Cabaret Beat, clips from a performance
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Interview with director Rosa von Praunheim about "A Virus Knows no Morals"
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon" by John Colin Penford
4. Dramatic reading of "More Lies" by Hektor Munoz
COMMERCIAL: Jack Albertson for the Fund for Human Dignity
5. Review of the play "Immortal" by Felice Picano
COMMERCIAL: Koos Fashion store
COMMERCIAL: Michael Greer show announcement
6. Book Reviews: Gay/Lesbian Almanac by Jonathan Katz, Byron and Greek Love by Louis Crompton, Ganymede in the Renaissance by James Saslow, White Trash Cooking by Ernest Mickler

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 195
[Air Date: 5/7/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Proposed immigration ban for AIDS infected persons
2. Bunceton, Missouri, openly gay mayor Gene Ulrich elected to fourth term
3. Seattle, lawyers guild attempts to block anti-gay activists from repealing protective ordinance, Council of Churches supports gay civil rights
4. Andy Humm on censoring yourself and gay liberation
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse sale
5. Interview with Connie Cohrt of the Greater Gotham Business Council
6. ICN, makers of Ribavirin, artificially inflated price of the drug in Mexico
7. Texas, first national AIDS hospital plans approved
8. National Cancer Institute renders AIDS virus harmless in the lab
9. Houston, Texas, council advises against health card proposal
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
10. Sports Report
11. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Doug Marcino, a volunteer in the Speaker's Bureau of GMHC's Education Department, on providing informational outreach about GMHC
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: E-Z Trim exercise equipment
2. Interview with author Gordon Merrick on his book "A Measure of Madness"
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Review of "Desert Hearts" film
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with Dear Abby
4. Interview with organizers of "Hocus Pocus" fundraiser event for children with AIDS, cuts off

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 21 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 197
[Air Date: 5/21/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Washington State, initiative proposed to make employing gays for jobs caring for children, the disabled, or senior citizens a gross misdemeanor; uses very discriminatory language to describe gays
2. Knoxville, Tennessee, church votes to allow Metropolitan Community Church to continue using its facility
3. Interview with co-coordinators of Heritage of Pride, Inc., discuss the forthcoming NYC Gay Pride March and Rally
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Notre Dame prohibits gay/lesbian group from using radio station
5. Andy Humm on Catholic church's prohibitive stance on priests and sexuality
6. California extends equal employment protection to gays and lesbians
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse sale
7. Wisconsin AIDS task force moves for contact testing
8. Travel tips for people with AIDS
9. California governor approves selective testing for HTLVIII antibody in "high-risk" patients
10. Proposed AIDS insurance bill revised to prohibit testing by insurance companies
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity
11. Sports Report
12. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Casey Donovan, sex-act performer, discussing safer sex and the proper use of condoms
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: E-Z Trim exercise equipment
2. Clips of Lyndon LaRouche discussing AIDS and Mark Fairchild discussing AIDS patients
3. Media Watch: interview with "Mandate" magazine editor, Freeman Gunther
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation featuring Jose Sarria
4. Interview with Phil Zwickler about "Rights and Reactions," a documentary film chronicling NYC's fight to pass the gay rights bill, with clips
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation, tape ends
