did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/9/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Washington, DC, City Council passes bill prohibiting insurance companies from denying coverage to "high risk" persons or those with HTLVIII antibody
2. Providence, Rhode Island, equal rights amendment killed by constitutional conventional committee
COMMERCIAL: First Hand gay magazine
3. Senatorial candidate Phil Reed discusses a state gay rights bill
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
4. Event announcement
5. Andy Humm discusses relationships breaking up
6. Anchorage, Alaska, Mayor opposes amendment of equal rights ordinance to include homosexuals
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Colorado, senate and house committees fail to vote on AIDS quarantine bill
8. US Senate raises AIDS research budget
9. AIDS becomes leading killer of men aged 30-44 and women aged 25-29 in New York City
10. Soldier is court-martialed after refusing to take a required HTLVIII antibody test
11. Two female high-schoolers allowed to attend prom together after a court order
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos resort, Puerto Rico
12. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: New York City Gay Men's Chorus
13. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Raymond Jacobs, discussing GMHC's erotic safer-sex movie "Chance of a Lifetime" and safer-sex workshops
14. Closing Credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
Interview with Kevin Glines, playwright and co-founder of non-profit gay arts organization The Glines
COMMERCIAL: Body-mate exercise equipment
Interview with Stephen Holt, playwright, discusses his play "The Casting of Kevin Christian," reading from play
COMMERCIAL: Water Front Airways

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 25 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/16/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Good effects of protective legislation for gays from insurance companies
2. New Jersey governor welcomes gays to the Republican Party
3. Interview with Terry Miller for "Mega Raffle," a fundraiser for gay-rights and education groups
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
4. Gay Pride Month, interview with Norman White of the Lesbian and Gay Community Center
5. Toronto school board votes down a ban on discrimination based on sexual orientation
6. Cincinnati: Andy Humm discusses hosting a gay pride march in a conservative city
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
7. Wellington, NZ: Insurance companies screening "high risk" applicants for HTLVIII
8. Interview with Gary Miller, from the New York City Gay Men's Chorus, on an upcoming concert, with clips
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
9. Boston: Bill for the protection of confidentiality of HTLVIII positive persons sent back for a vote
10. AIDS Project Los Angeles lists donators names on billboards
11. 1st Annual San Francisco AIDS Bike-a-thon raises $250,000 for AIDS organizations, NYC AIDS Walk-a-thon raises $700,000
12. Announcement: "Freedom Voyage '86"
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos resort, Puerto Rico
13. Sports Report, interview with Jim Skofield for the Gay Pride Run
14. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Joanne Mantell discussing GMHC's award from the Centers for Disease Control to reduce high-risk sex practices
15. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
1. Announcements
2. Interview with Robert Chesley, author of the play, "Pigman," discussing safe sex as anti-eroticism
COMMERCIAL: Body-mate exercise equipment
3. Clips of Sybil Bruncheon speaking at GCN of Cincinnati, tape cuts off

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 26 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/23/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Maine: Obscenity referendum to ban items of a sexual nature defeated
2. Massachusetts: Bill passed assuring privacy protection for HTLVIII positive persons
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
3. Interview with John Glines, discussing Stamp Out AIDS Project
4. Missouri: Anti-gay lawmaker fails in an attempt to ban gays from teaching in schools
5. Andy Humm discusses the 17th Anniversary of the Stonewall riots
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
6. Mayor Edward Koch attacked by homophobe at the Proclamation for Lesbian and Gay Pride Week, with clip
7. Adair Films loses its contract to make an AIDS documentary to a non-gay company
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
8. Hawaii: Governor signs measure ensuring confidentiality of those testing positive for sexually transmitted diseases
9. Lesbians at high risk for discrimination following the AIDS epidemic, despite being at lowest risk for the disease
10. Call for volunteers for a national study of drug treatments to treat AIDS/HTLVIII positive persons
11. Researchers grow AIDS virus in animal cells for the first time
12. Announcements about Gay Pride Weekend
COMMERCIAL: New York City Gay Men's Chorus
13. Sports Report
14. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Psychotherapist Michael Shernoff discussing eroticizing safer sex
15. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Coverage of the Cincinnati Gay Pride Parade, includes clips of the march, the mayor reading equal rights amendment, GCN ensemble singing "Steppin' Out"
COMMERCIAL: New York City Gay Men's Chorus
2. Interview with David Summers, cabaret singer and AIDS activist, regarding "Hero of My Own Life," with clip
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" magazine
3. Announcement of "Ten By Tennessee" production of Tennessee Williams' plays
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 27 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/30/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. USA Today poll finds American fathers fear their children becoming gay
2. Jerry Fallwell warns of financial disaster for the anti-gay organization Liberty Christian Academy
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
3. 4th of July Interview with "the Statue of Liberty" (Bill Baumer in a costume)
4. National Association of Business Councils folds
5. Andy Humm discusses the concept of liberty and discrimination
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
6. House revises the codes prohibiting sexual assault to include men
7. Official Stamp Out AIDS stamps announced
8. HTLVIII antibody found in only 1% of infected persons' saliva
8. Yoga seminars offered to assist those with AIDS in keeping healthy, physically and mentally
9. Washington DC mayor signs into law a bill prohibiting insurance companies from denying coverage to those who test positive for the HTLVIII antibody
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
10. Sport Report
11. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Kevin Madden discussing volunteering at GMHC
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: Freedom Cruise '86 AIDS Benefit
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby, taped recording from Cincinnati Gay Pride
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" magazine
2. Interview with Michael Musto, Village Voice columnist, on his book "Downtown," documenting the night scene in 1980s New York City
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
3. Coverage of the Gay and Lesbian Community Services Center's 3rd Annual Garden Party
COMMERCIAL: Water Front Airways

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 29 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 7/15/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. California, anti-gay Lyndon LaRouche is successful at getting an initiative on the ballot that would define AIDS as an infectious disease, allowing for quarantining, mandatory testing for suspected persons, and dismissal from public office
2. Coverage of protests against the Georgia sodomy laws in New York City on July 4th
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
3. Interview with Evan Wolfson from Lambda Legal Defense about Georgia sodomy laws and Bowers vs Hardwick
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Andy Humm on the July 4th demonstration against the sodomy laws and liberation
5. July as "Make the President Aware Month"
6. Los Angeles, Spanish-language AIDS hotline funded by the government
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Sports Report
8. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Bruce Patterson and Scott Jordan, discussing establishing a relationship in this anxious time and as a person with AIDS
8. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" magazine
2. Coverage of the New York City Gay Pride Parade by GCN Cincinnati, with clips
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
3. Small items and clips of new bathing suit styles for men, tape cuts off

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 30 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 7/22/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. The AIDS-centered play "The Normal Heart" banned from performing at Washington D.C.'s Kennedy Center after the Supreme Court ruling on the Georgia sodomy laws
2. Man sues the San Diego Police Dept. for arresting him at their Gay Pride Parade and forcibly administering the HTLVIII antibody test
3. Urvashi Vaid becomes the Information Director of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force
4. Officer court-martialed for refusing to submit to testing for the HTLVIII antibody
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
5. Iowa's Democratic Party Convention refuses to change the state constitution to give gays a vote on the central committee
6. Andy Humm on courage
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
7. Chicago judge vacates court order for gay fathers to have to take the HTLVIII antibody test before being allowed to have custody of their children
8. Introduction of laws for the regulation of "poppers" as a recreational drug
9. Ability of men to get pregnant by implanting a fertilized egg in the anus
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
10. Sports Report
11. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Second part of the interview with Bruce Patterson and Scott Jordan, discussing relationships as a person with AIDS
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. The Fabulous Follies: Drag star Hurricane Sommers lip-synchs to Patti Labelle's song "Oh" over clips of NYC's Gay Pride Parade
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" magazine
2. Newsweek magazine coverage, discussion of NYC AIDS doctor and homosexual abuse by a Massachusetts college president
3. Channel 5's coverage of the Georgia sodomy laws, with clips
4. Rate of AIDS in Haiti among straight men and women very high
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
7. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 31 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 7/29/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. International Conference on AIDS in Paris finds little hope of a cure, but several effective treatments, including AZT
2. National survey by the University of Pennsylvania ranks consensual homosexual acts as a more severe crime than creating a neighborhood disturbance or smoking marijuana
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
3. Interview with Julian Schroeder, Democratic candidate for New York Congress
4. London branch of British Labour Party bans family photos from campaign literature as it unfairly promotes heterosexualism
5. Two London men charged with shocking public behavior for kissing at a bus stop
6. Andy Humm on the promotion of condoms in the media
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
7. Methodist Church conference supports the protection and assistance of those with AIDS
8. Discovery of general protection for cells from the HTLVIII virus announced at the International AIDS conference in Paris
9. San Francisco, rate of transmission of AIDS has declined sharply since 1984 due to changes in sexual behavior
10. San Francisco, Sandra Day O'Connor's visit to city hall prompts protests and police brutality
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
11. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
12. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with David Summers, AIDS activist with the People with AIDS Coalition
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This week in gay history with Jeff Bixby
COMMECIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Brandon Judell on Keith Clark's book "Being Sexual and Celibate" and the Meese Commission on Pornography, with clips
3. Repeat of Judell's interview with journalist and writer Michael Musto
4. Report on AIDS in the workplace
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
5. San Francisco Gay Pride Parade footage
6. Closing credits

[Air Date: 8/21/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Proposal for a Chicago gay rights bill is voted down
2. LA Times poll finds opinion of total population on homosexuals does not align with Jerry Falwell's conservative fundamentalist Christian followers
3. Olympia, Washington, anti-gay group fails to get enough signatures to remove the city's gay rights ordinance
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Justice Warren Burger's attendance at a New York City event protested by the Gay and Lesbian Rights Coalition, with clips
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
5. SUNY Stony Brook Gay and Lesbian Alliance members harassed by the football team and other students
6. Andy Humm on Civics and New York elections
7. Funding for a Maryland AIDS education organization delayed by Maryland state legislative panel
8. California governor George Deukmejian vetoes a bill protecting people with AIDS from discrimination
9. Washington DC's House and Senate approve amendments to improve funding for AIDS care and research
10. Gay World Series Softball Competition announced
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
11. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Ruth Rodriguez and Dooley Worth on women with AIDS
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This week in gay history with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Coverage of the 1986 Gay Games in San Francisco, with clips of the opening ceremony
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
3. Brandon Judell with gossip tidbits and clips from the Phil Donahue Show on violence against gays
COMMERCIAL: Water Front Airways
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 35 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 8/22/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Missouri legislature upholds state's sexual misconduct laws declaring same sex relations immoral
2. Canada, radio talk show host faces disciplinary action for on-air anti-gay comments
3. Interview with Joanne Mantell, the director of GMHC's study to reduce high-risk sex practices in the gay community
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation featuring Jose Sarria
4. New Zealand, Parliament votes to decriminalize homosexual sex
5. Chicago, National Organization of Gay and Lesbian Scientists and Technical Professionals produce brochure on the contributions to society of homosexual scientists
5. Andy Humm discusses European openness towards AIDS education on the television
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
6. Warning about the unknown effects of spermicidal lube on rectal tissues during anal intercourse
7. The US Office of Civil Rights unwilling to respond to reports of discrimination against persons with AIDS
COMMERCIAL: Phil Reed for New York State Senate
8. Sports Report including an interview with Cliff Goulet on Gay Games '86 and clips from the Closing Ceremony
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
9. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Vin Longo of GMHC's Intake Department for new patients
10. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This week in gay history with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Woman Talk" theater piece
2. Interview with director Derek Jarman on his film "Caravaggio" and the artist's life, with clips, tape cuts off

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 36 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 8/29/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Reagan administration issues a formal apology to medical researcher whose study of AIDS transmission by casual contact were misrepresented in a Justice Department memo
2. Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation launches the 701 Club, a fundraiser to combat anti-gay groups
3. Miami Yellow Pages now allows terms gay, lesbian, homosexual in ads
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Jerry Falwell's newest phone number to prevent women getting abortions announced
5. Andy Humm on the gay voting block and supporting pro-gay candidates above other political concerns
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
6. CDC separates AIDS-positive homosexual IV drug user statistics from those of drug-free homosexuals, creating a better perspective of the statistics
7. Governor John Ashcroft of Missouri puts guidelines in place to protect persons with AIDS from discrimination in government employment
8. Washington State tells Frito Lay they must obey anti-discrimination laws when doing business in the state
9. California Secretary of State wins suit preventing Lyndon LaRouche group from supplying false information to voters on AIDS quarantine initiative
10. Howard Stern advocating violence to "cure" gays, number announced for viewers to flood phone lines
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
11. Sports Report, footage from the 10th Annual Gay Softball World Series
12. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with erotic performer, Casey Donovan, on proper condom use (repeat)
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Coverage of San Francisco's "Closet Ball," with clips from the drag competition
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Interview with hardcore porn director Christopher Rage
COMMERCIAL: "Woman Talk" theater piece
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
3. Closing credits

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Plans for a 1987 national gay demonstration in Washington, DC
2. California, gathering support in Hollywood against the LaRouche AIDS quarantine referendum
3. Former President Jimmy Carter tells Jerry Falwell to "go to hell"
4. Andy Humm on President Reagan's silence regarding AIDS health crisis
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
5. Radio for Europe announcer names New York City mayor Ed Koch and San Francisco mayor Diane Feinstein as homosexuals
6. Pentagon announces expansion of HIV antibody testing program to include students enrolled in ROTC programs
7. CDC research program on AIDS delayed due to in-fighting amongst researchers
8. Failure of experimental vaccine to protect against AIDS-like infection in simians
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
9. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: Vivian Shapiro for the Human Rights Campaign Fund
10. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Clips of Cincinnati's drag performer, Hurricane Sommers
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser
3.Excerpt from Phil Donahue's "Human Animal" on gays in America and coming out
4. Interview with J. D. Slater, gay porn director and actor
COMMERCIAL: "Woman Talk" theater piece
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
5. Continuation of interview with director Derek Jarman
6. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 40 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 9/29/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Chicago passenger sues American Airlines for exposing her to AIDS when an employee bit her after an altercation
2. Evangelical Women's Caucus International approves resolution endorsing civil rights protection for homosexuals
3. ACLU declares the New Orleans ordinance banning cross-dressing and lewd behavior unconstitutional
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Man accused of murdering wife after she called him gay
5. Andy Humm on radio host Bob Grant spreading hatred against gays
6. Ferrysburg, Michigan wants to change town name due to teasing over connotation of "fairies"
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
7. Newman's Own company includes American Foundation for AIDS Research in its list of charities
8. AZT approved for use in the United States, for certain cases of AIDS
9. Psych study finds gays as anxious about growing old as straight men, eroding the "old queen" stereotype
10. Reading viewer donation letters
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser
11. Sports Report, interview with Joe Franco about "Gayrobics"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation with Jose Sarria
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Coverage of "With the Greatest of Ease" gay band convention
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Mystic Fire video, clips of Paul Bowles interview
3. Clips from AZT news conference, coverage from CNN
4. TV show Superior Court deals with AIDS controversy
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser
5. Interview with proponent of alternative AIDS therapy using Vitamin C injections
6. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 42 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 10/13/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. President Reagan upsets San Franciscans and persons with AIDS with his homophobic comments
2. Former Senator John Schmitz apologizes for his offensive comments regarding pro-choice women and homosexuals
3. Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force offers recommendations for educating homosexual students to school board
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser
4. Texas employees attempt to change anti-discrimination laws to include protection for homosexuals
5. Andy Humm on acceptance of homophobia in the media
6. Newspaper for Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Chicago rejects ad from Catholic groups calling for support of gay civil liberties
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
7. Coverage of the protest against the Georgia sodomy laws and the Rehnquist Supreme Court
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
8. Coverage of protests against Jerry Falwell's rally in support for anti-abortionists
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation with Jose Sarria
9. Minneapolis begins media campaign to educate general populace about AIDS
10. Study finds that homosexuality in men may be a genetic or familial trait
11. Government scientist finds a new AIDS-related virus
12. Reading of thank you letters to Gay Cable Network
13. Sports Report
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Interview with director Leslie Irons and actor David Drake regarding their new play, "Dancin' in the Dark," with clips
COMMERCIAL: GCN's "SUDS" gay soap opera looking for locations
3. Coverage and interviews regarding the new film "The Name of the Rose"
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 43 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 10/20/1986] [3]--GCN/CB No. 39

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Jerry Falwell loses $5000 for on-air anti-gay comments
2. Chicago, mayor's endorsement of gay civil rights bill despite its defeat, and stamping of US currency with "gay dollar"
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser
3. Interview with Michael Hardwick and Sue Lebo, a member of the Lesbian Rights Project, regarding the next step in combating decision in Georgia sodomy case, Bowers v Hardwick
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Alexandria, Virginia gay community sponsors advertizing campaign to promote acceptance of homosexuals
5. Andy Humm on the death of Diego Lopez, director of the Gay Men's Health Crisis, and the need for more activism and involvement in the community
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
6. San Francisco mayor Diane Feinstein states city's gay pride parade promotes rampant and un-safe promiscuity
7. Dallas Gay Alliance places billboards in low-income and ethnic areas to help educate minorities about AIDS
8. Authorities urging all those who are high risk for infection to take the HTLVIII antibody test
9. Washington State Insurance Commission holds last public hearing on insurance companies using HTLVIII antibody testing and lifestyle questions to deny coverage
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation with Jose Sarria
10. Sports Report
11. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, clips from "Betty Blue"
2. Clips for ABC's coverage of Lyndon LaRouche and California AIDS quarantine bill
3. Attempt to turn Rhyolite, Nevada into the first town for gays
4. Another clip from "Betty Blue"
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: GCN's "SUDS" gay soap opera looking for locations
5. Conclusion of interview with director Derek Jarman
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser
6. Closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 10/27/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Atlanta, City Council defeats attempt to repeal a gay rights clause in city's Bill of Rights
2. Voting underway to change federal prohibitions on rape to be defined as sexual assault on another person, regardless of sex or age, and including spouse-on-spouse assault
3. $111,000 from a benefactor's will to go to Lambda legal defense and education and the Human Rights Fund
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser, with John Glines
4. Trikone organized for gay and lesbians of South Asian decent
5. Andy Humm on 1986 Maryland senate race
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
6. World Health Organization announces significant increase in AIDS cases
7. California governor George Deukmejian vetoes anti-discrimination bill for people with AIDS
8. Potential vaccine for AIDS enters period of animal testing
9. AIDS treatment involving ozone applies to begin human trials
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: GCN pledge drive, with clips from the year's news
11. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Announcement of death from AIDS of Michael Rock, co-creator of "Rockshots" erotic greeting cards, with clips from Playboy TV feature
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation with Jose Sarria
3. Interview with Denise Harbin about the TIPPS advertising guide to creative resources in New York City
COMMERCIAL: Gay Cable Network fundraiser, with John Glines
4. David Summers' birthday party with Broadway guests and performances
5. Unnamed man at The Advocate's "man search" party does a striptease
6. Closing credits

[Air Date: 10/28/1986] [3]--Dr. Farkle

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: SAN FRANCISCO EDITION OF 231.0709

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Atlanta, City Council defeats attempt to repeal a gay rights clause in city's Bill of Rights
2. Voting underway to change federal prohibitions on rape to be defined as sexual assault on another person, regardless of sex or age, and including spouse-on-spouse assault
3. $111,000 from a benefactor's will to go to Lambda legal defense and education and the Human Rights Fund
4. California gubernatorial candidate Tom Bradley turns toward the gay vote
5. Hollywood stars lend their support to a "No on 64" labor rally
6. Call for public access channel KQED to broadcast more gay-oriented programming
7. AIDS PSA television spots begin airing on San Francisco CBS affiliate
8. Virginia Appuzo named by Governor Cuomo as vice-chair of the New York State AIDS Advisory Council
COMMERCIAL: Shanti Project featuring Mikhail Baryshnikov
9. Research for an AIDS vaccine estimated at $1.6 billion
10. Notre Dame University rules against a gay-oriented student committee
11. US Attorney General encourages AIDS education for elementary school children, with reactions from San Franciscans
12. Supreme Court petitioned by the Gay Games to their right to use the word "Olympic"
13. West Hollywood mayoral race is plagued by scandals
14. Interview with Pat Norman, candidate for Supervisor
15. Weekly commentary from Sally Gearhart on Measure M and development of downtown San Francisco
16. News reporter Jane Dornacker dies in helicopter crash during a live broadcast
17. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Announcements
COMMERCIAL: Shanti Project, featuring Cynthia Harvey
2. Interview with author and wiccan, Zsuzsanna Budapest
3. Clips from stage show, "The Nightclub of the Living Dead"
4. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
5. Fundraiser announcement
6. Movie Reviews, Halloween-themed
7. Performance by San Francisco's Gay Men's Chorus' barbershop quartet
8. "Ask Dr Farkle" segment about hitting on lesbians
9. S Diana Bogus reads Edgar Allen Poe's "The Raven" over the closing credits

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. San Diego man secures life insurance coverage after being denied due to homosexuality
2. Philadelphia school board hears council about teaching nondiscrimination for gay students
3. Alexandria, Virginia city council postpones voting on a gay rights measure indefinitely
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
4. Vermont man "cured" of being homosexual carries a 50 lb. cross across the state
5. Andy Humm on the state of politics with a Democrat-controlled Senate
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
6. London, Education Secretary upset with educational book about a child with homosexual parents, calling it "homosexual propaganda"
7. Study shows being bitten or scratched by AIDS patient carries little chance of spreading the virus
8. Early testing shows three new AIDS drugs block spread of virus without side effects of AZT
9. Circumcision rate for US males sharply declines
COMMERCIAL: GCN pledge drive, with clips from the year's news
9. Sports Report, interview with Tom Hansen, commissioner of MCAA Bowling
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Interview with the director of "The Decline of the American Empire," Denys Arcand
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. "Just Ask Raz" advice segment
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Coverage of the Christopher Street Halloween Parade
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation with Jose Sarria
4. Interview with calendar model, Andre Fiset
5. Closing credits

[Air Date: 11/18/1986]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Coverage of David Summers' death, with clips
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
2. Anita Bryant's anti-gay history discussed
3. ACLU votes to endorse the legalization of same-sex marriages
4. Ohio's Cuyahoga County Board of Commissioners bans job discrimination based on sexual orientation
5. Andy Humm on the Catholic Church's promotion of violence against homosexuals
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
6. Certain PBS stations decline to air documentary, "The AIDS Show," on the invisible effects of AIDS
7. Telephone poll in San Francisco shows the effects of AIDS on the gay community
8. California passes new law regulating the sale of "poppers" recreational drug
9. White House Drug Advisor finds that heavy marijuana use can make people gay
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
10. Sports Report
11. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. "Just Ask Raz" advice segment
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Clips from AIDS discussion on the People's Court
4. Interview with director, Rosa von Praunheim, regarding his film "A Virus Knows no Morals"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
5. Second part of interview with calendar model, Andre Fiset
COMMERCIAL: Paint-on tattoo kit
COMMERCIAL: PFLAG condoms
COMMERCIAL: GCN pledge drive, with Jack Wrangler

accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. President Reagan makes largest allocation yet for AIDS research in 1987
2. Tom Chorlton plans to resign from his post as head of the National Association of Gay and Lesbian Democratic Clubs
3. Flight attendant with AIDS grounded due to possibility of spread through casual contact
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Florida state Representative, Byron Combee resigns after being caught touching an undercover police officer in a lewd manner in a public park
5. Chicago, "gay dollars" are in wide distribution, despite the efforts of certain banks to destroy the marked dollars
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
6. Sale of condoms has dramatically risen
7. Part one of report on two new tests for AIDS infection
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
8. Sports Report
9. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Review of "Nunsense" off-Broadway show, with clips
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Interview with director, Phil Zwickler
COMMERCIAL: The World of Video VHS store
4. Coverage of the fundraising event, "22 on the Red"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation, with Jose Sarria
5. Just Ask Raz advice segment

[Air Date: 12/2/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. National Gay and Lesbian Task Force reduces its debt in half over the course of six months
2. Proliferation of bumper stickers in Chicago reading "Stop AIDS, Castrate Gays"
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
3. London, formation of Lesbians and Gays Support the Print Workers to take on Rupert Murdoch
4. Andy Humm on the division of gays during the conference for the March on Washington DC
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
5. California, gay father given equal time to respond to 700 Club member's accusations of lewdness and child abuse
6. Washington, DC, coverage of politics and clips of openly gay politicians discussing the gay and lesbian political agenda
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Seattle, Washington, 3 of 5 TV stations refuse to air AIDS awareness announcement
8. Study finds that 3/4ths of the people with CMV strain of AIDS show improvement after treatment with the experimental drug DHPG
9. Congress refuses to overturn Washington D.C.'s AIDS insurance law prohibiting providers from testing for AIDS infection prior to insurance approval
10. Sports Report, with clips from film, "American Anthem"
11. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, with clips from "LA Law" about an AIDS victim, and interview with culinary writer Sara Friedman, on wild mushrooms
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Oh, Coward!" Broadway revue

[Air Date: unknown]

accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. NEW FORMAT: Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Joyce Hunter, and Darrell Yates Rist
2. US State Dept requires employees to take HIV antibody test, disallowing those positive from working abroad
3. Vermont put $150,000 to educate state about AIDS, NYC Board of Education produces a public school film "Sex, Drugs, and AIDS"
4. Kentucky state county judge ruled that Sodomy Laws violate the Kentucky state constitution
5.Discussion of a National Gay and Lesbian March on Washington DC, Oct 11th 1987
6. Discussion of the New York Times' playing down the threat of AIDS infection for heterosexual couples, and misrepresentation of the statistical facts of infection
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
7. Andy Humm on Cary Grant's lawsuit against Chevy Chase
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
8. Continuing coverage of the 2nd annual meeting of gay and lesbian elected officials in Washington, DC
9. National Association of Gay and Lesbian Democratic Clubs to remain part of the party despite 53% voting to remove Democratic affiliation
10. Mood of the gay and lesbian leaders, and need for a national leader like Harvey Milk
11. Gay politicians agree to back the March in Washington DC
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
12. News Brief, announcements
13. Belle Glade, Florida, study finds high rate of AIDS infections due to sexual contact and IV drug use
14. Georgia Fraternal Order of Police Officers tries to ban homosexuals from joining the force
15. Gay man forced to resign from Canadian Mounted Police sues the department
16. Man banned from seeing his child due to positive HTLVIII test appeals the court's decision
17. Announcement of film "Rights and Reactions"
18. Sports Report, with clips from the 1986 Gay Games
19. Closing credits over news clips of tennis star Boris Becker

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, with clips from "Escape from Alcatraz"
3. Announcement of Cary Grant's death and homosexual rumors, with clips
4. Richard Pryor's Barbara Walters' special on question of AIDS status, with clips

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 51 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 12/11/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Joyce Hunter, Darrell Yates Rist, and Tom Stoddard
2. Catholic bishop forbids AIDS Project Los Angeles from holding seminars in Catholic buildings due to the project's endorsement of condom use
3. National Gay Rights Advocates win $3 million settlement for San Francisco homosexuals who were denied employment or promotion by Pacific Bell
4. Discussion of the New York Board of Education's AIDS awareness film, "Sex, Drug, and AIDS"
5. Discussion of bathhouses and the possible reopening of NYC's largest, St Mark's Bathhouse
6. Discussion of the State Department's requirement for HTLVIII testing for applicants and employees
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
7. Andy Humm on refusing to cooperate with AIDS-discriminatory job practices
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
8. World Health Organization finds AIDS rates may soar in Latin America and Asia
9. Justice Sandra Day O'Connor finds that the Supreme Court's decision on the Georgia sodomy case may be altered by further prosecution and hearings
10. Austin, Texas, proposal for banning the discrimination on the basis of sexual preference generally supported
11. Alabama, Birmingham News requires job applicants to take HIV test and bans those positive from jobs
12. Jackson, Mississippi, State bans language of sexual equality from Constitution, opting for ban on "gender" discrimination only
13. San Francisco, National Gay Rights Advocates issue complaint against Health America's rejection of all San Francisco applicants in order to avoid AIDS-positive applicants
14. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
15. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Announcement, 1986 Sydney Gay Mardi Gras program preview party, with clips
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of The High Heeled Women's "It's A Broad, Broad, Broad World," with clips
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
3. "Just Ask Raz" advice segment
COMMERCIAL: The World of Video
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 52 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 12/22/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Joyce Hunter, Darrell Yates Rist, and Tom Stoddard
2. Discussion of particular problems homosexuals face during the holiday season, including coming out to parents, bringing partner to holiday dinner, coping with intolerant family
3. AIDS transmission outside the bloodstream, and ability to infect tissue, and the New York Times' continuing bias of male anal sex as primary method of infection
4. State's Constitutional rights in light of the Bowers v Hardwick sodomy case decision
5. Discussion of "gifts" each guest has received this year, including the strengthening of the gay community in the national spotlight
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
6. Andy Humm on enlightening the ignorant through vocal support for gay rights
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
7. Hotline for latest treatments for AIDS and experimental treatments
8. Federal government's AIDS hotline becomes privatized, is expanding to 24 hours, moving to NYC
9. Lee University in Pennsylvania grants official status to a gay, lesbian, and bisexual student group
10. 62 new AIDS education PSAs used to educate average TV viewer, starring an assortment of Hollywood celebrities
11. Lesbian woman ends legal fight over her dismissal from the ROTC in 1982
12. Newly adopted Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986 continues to include language that can be used to ban gay people from entering the country
13. Philadelphia, police commissioner appoints a liaison to the gay community and commits to fully investigating complaints of anti-gay violence and hate
14. Sports Report, with clips of Greg Louganis performing a circus act
15. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of off-Broadway musical, "Have I Got a Girl for You!"
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
3. Michael Weyand interviews Walter Williams about his study of homosexuality in Native American culture, "The Spirit and the Flesh"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
4. Reminder from Razor Sharp to contact those friends who do not have families
5. $100.000 gained in an art auction to benefit five AIDS organizations in San Francisco

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 1 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 12/31/1986]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
Special Episode "1986 in Review," with GCN clips and coverage from the year
1. Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation protests outside the New York Post offices
2. Coverage of the National Gay and Lesbian Taskforce meeting, featuring interviews with Sara Throne, Virginia Apuzzo, Peter Fowler, Urvashi Vaid on the impact and continuing future of the gay service organization
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
3. Mayor Koch attacked at the Proclamation of 1987 Gay Pride Week
4. Andy Humm on the 17th anniversary of the Stonewall Riots
5. Raymond Jacobs on the psychological impact of AIDS on communities
6. Gay Friends and Neighbors in Brooklyn
7. Coverage of the 17th Annual Gay and Lesbian Pride Day Parade in New York, 29 June 1986
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
8. Raymond Jacobs on dealing with AIDS related deaths in the young gay community
9. Clips from the July 4th 1986 NYC protest against the Supreme Court passage of the "Sodomy Laws"
10. Interview with Michael Hardwick, of the Bowers v. Hardwick Georgia "Sodomy Laws" case, and discussion of the case
11. Lyndon LaRouche placing the "AIDS quarantine" initiative on the California ballot
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: Dr. Ruth taping, call for gay guests to attend
12. "Stamp Out AIDS" project, interview with John Glines
13. Gay Christopher St Festival Committee sponsors a candlelight vigil for AIDS Resources Center Inc, which cares for homeless persons with AIDS
14. Gina Alvarez discusses the increase of activism of young gay students, especially on college campuses
15. Human Rights Campaign Fund Dinner, with speeches by Coretta Scott King and Harvey Fierstein
16. Closing credits, over clips of the Village Halloween Parade

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 2 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 1/6/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, special "looking ahead" discussion, with Andy Humm, Joyce Hunter, and Darrell Yates Rist
2. Expecting AIDS statistics continuing to rise, especially among heterosexual couples
3. Expected AIDS funding, or lack there of, from the Reagan administration
4. Possible cures and vaccines for AIDS
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Condom ads on network television?
6. Closeted or out attitudes of gay persons in 1987
7. Funding for lesbian and gay services
8. Progression or overturning of sodomy laws
9. March on Washington DC
10. Guests answer questions, "If you could change one thing for gay people this year, what would it be?" and "Do you think Ronald Reagan is going to be in office at the end of this year?"
COMMERCIAL: "Gay Year in Review" VHS tape
11. Andy Humm on letter-writing to politicians
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
12. San Francisco organization, Mobilization Against AIDS, plans to launch a national boycott of Delta Airlines for its gay rights violations
13. Committee of Interns and Residents votes to refuse to hold conventions in states with sodomy laws
14. Amsterdam, plan to build monument to memory of homosexuals killed by the Nazis in World War II
15. Georgia, in first ruling since passage of sodomy laws, two men were fined and given community service for committing sodomy
16. Sacramento, council members tried to overturn the city's gay rights bill
17. Boston, Beth Israel Hospital employee fired for not working with AIDS patients, attempts to get unemployment benefits
18. Sports Report, interview with Ron Keel of the Manhattan Community Athletic Association about getting gay persons involved in activities
19. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, Stephen Holden's NY Times review of comedy act Barb Nelson's negative stereotypes
2. Interview with playwright Robert Patrick of "Blue is for Boys," and actors Allan Gassman and David Gallagher
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Pageant" the satirical drag show-themed musical COMMERCIAL: The Monster
4. Interview with a furrier from New York's Zamir Furs about maintenance and type of fur coats for men
5. Christmas message from GCN San Francisco to GCN New York
6. And Another Thing... with Brett Siereveld on having pride as a gay person
COMMERCIAL: Zamir furs
7. Closing credits over coverage of a bowling event

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 3 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 1/12/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Joyce Hunter, Darrell Yates Rist, and Evan Wolfson
2. AIDS and the right to privacy, with special reference to public figures
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
3. The media's ignoring gay-related news stories in their year-in-review issues, gay visibility
4. Gay survivors of AIDS deaths, legal victories, and marriage rights
COMMERCIAL: GCN's "Year in Review"
5. Andy Humm on Reagan's lack of AIDS funding in 1987 budget
6. New law forbids the Military from using HIV testing program for "adverse actions" against gay service members
7. Denver, St John Episcopal Cathedral opens a housing complex exclusively for people with AIDS
8. Tennessee, Tri-Cities AIDS project conduct awareness education
9. San Francisco man successfully challenges his insurance company to gain health benefits
10. Minnesota, governor issues executive order banning discrimination based on sexual orientation for state employees
11. Lutheran Church of America encourages the welcoming of homosexuals as full members of their community
12. Minneapolis, procurator for a male prostitution service charged with one year in a workhouse for exposing prostitutes to AIDS
13. Sports Report, interview with bowler "Gutter George"
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, clips from a show about witch doctors in South Africa dealing with AIDS
3. Announcement of book, "Conversations with my Elders" by Boze Hadleigh
4. Interview with Nicholas Deutsch, director of the off-Broadway play "Jerker"
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
5. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of the off-Broadway play "Groucho: A Life in Review"
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
6. Razor Sharp gives etiquette pointers for telephone sex
COMMERCIAL: TeleContractor phone sex hotline

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 4 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 1/16/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Joyce Hunter, Darrell Yates Rist, and Evan Wolfson
2. Short news bits
3. Discussion of ex-gay man with AIDS who wants to be married in a Catholic church and discrimination against gay people and persons with AIDS
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Discussion of the "Baby M" surrogate case and its possible impact on the gay community
5. UCLA poll finds 52% of national graduating college students support laws prohibiting homosexual behavior
COMMERCIAL: GCN's "Year in Review" VHS tape
6. Andy Humm on the rates of unprotected sex among teenagers
7. News Briefs, three of anti-gay Patt Robinson's tax-exempt groups audited by IRS
8. London, Anglican churchmen advised to work out individual issues with homosexuality before attending at the bedside of a gay person dying of AIDS
9. Philadelphia, Colin Cook resigns from Quest ex-gay Learning center for engaging in sexual activities with students
10. East Lansing, Michigan, agrees to strengthen anti-discrimination protection for gays and other minorities
11. Oregon, gay inmates in prison allowed to kiss and hold hands during visits
12. Sports Report
13. Feature story on Gay Cable Network by Japanese program "New Yorking," with behind-the-scenes footage of GCN
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Moments of Meditation, satirical segment with Ernest T. Lee
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcement of "La Cage aux Folles" closing in London
4. Interview with members of GLAAD, writers Marcia Pally and James Saslow, discussion of the media's coverage of homosexuality
COMMERCIAL: Zamir's Furs
5. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of off-Broadway play, "Jerker"
COMMERCIAL: A Different Light bookstore
6. Olivia Negron interviews Robert Drucker, banker at the Actor's Federal Credit Union
7. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 5 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 1/26/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Evan Wolfson
2. Discussion of gays voting for anti-gay political leaders
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
3. Congress looks into banning cigarette ads, and the regulation of private decisions by government
4. Re-opening gay bathhouses and the ethics of this
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on Catholic conservatives intervening in the youth sex education
6. News Briefs, In Seattle, Oregon's human rights commission prohibits discrimination against persons with AIDS
7. Connecticut's first housing complex exclusively for people with AIDS raises $30,000
8. AZT drug available only in limited supply when it becomes available
9. Chinese government requires foreign students to take HTLVIII virus test
10. Austin city council passes anti-discrimination bill
11. South Korea requires mandatory AIDS testing for all employees of service industries
12. Sports Report
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcements
3. Interview with Michael Petrelis a resident of the Bailey House for people with AIDS
COMMERCIAL: The World of Video
4. Show Bits, George Trahanis reviews Broadway play, "Stepping Out," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
5. Conclusion of Michael Weyand's interview of Walter Williams, author of "The Spirit in the Flesh"
6. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/2/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Kitty Cotter, and Jim Levin
2. Short news stories
3. Gay Catholic group petitions New York City for the right to demonstrate outside of St. Patrick's Cathedral
4. Discussion of publicly-closeted gay politicians courting the gay vote
5. Accurate government reporting of AIDS, and the privacy issues involved in listing AIDS on death certificates
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
6. Andy Humm on Reagan's Education secretary, William Bennett, opposing AIDS Education programs in schools
7. News Watch, Colorado lawmakers ready to approve the testing, tracing, and quarantining individuals suspected of being infected with HIV
8. San Francisco, Chronicle discloses its policy prohibiting the listing of surviving lovers in death notices
9. ACLU considering suing nursing homes in Illinois that refuse to accept persons with AIDS
10. Dutch National Broadcasting Service has begun a television service for lesbians and gay men
11. Paper finds that certain DNA viruses have the ability to activate latent AIDS viruses
12. Senator Edward Kennedy promises adequate AIDS budget beyond Reagan's lackluster budget
13. Sports Report
14. New segment Lavender Health, presented by the Office of Gay and Lesbian Health Concerns of the New York City Department of Health, discussion of AIDS-phobia
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
15. George Trahanis interviews Jeff Goodman, Secretary of the Board of the Greater Gotham Business Council
16. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. GCN Cincinnati TV episode, "Georgia Vice"
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Broadway musical "Beehive"
4. COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity ball
5. Olivia Negron interviews Gerard Ilaria, a volunteer social worker at New York Hospital and Columbia University Gay Health Advocacy Project
6. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/10/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin
2. Short news stories
3. Updates about the March on Washington, including discussion of the demands of community on government
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
3. Criticism of GMHC's lack of an active political front, and emphasis on social service in the community
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Gay rights advocate and psychiatrist, Emery Hetrick's obituary
5. News Watch, a study by the University of California, Berkeley finds that gay men who only engage in oral sex or insertive anal intercourse have a lower risk of contracting AIDS virus
6. Philadelphia, a gay city employee charges the city with violation of its gay rights law by not allowing his lover certain rights
7. San Francisco, openly gay Tom Nolan elected President of the San Mateo Board of Supervisors
8. People traveling to Mexico to buy experimental AIDS treatment drugs will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law as drug smugglers
9. Warren, Michigan, mayor bans local cable company from airing gay program "The Lambda Report" on its public access channel
10. San Francisco, two former members of the satirical protest group, The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, register legally as the "official San Francisco 1987 papal welcoming committee"
11. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
12. Lavender Health, interview with Stephen Schaefer, coordinator of the AIDS Hotline
13. George Trahanis's closing statement
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Blue is for Boys" and interview with actor, Allen Gassman
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, short news stories
4. Judell interviews Canadian comedian, Lorne Elliott
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
5. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her
6. Olivia Negron, closing statements
7. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 8 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/17/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Currently not available for viewing.

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 9 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/23/1987] [3]--Men and Films, Episode No. 9

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Tim Coglin
2. Short news stories
3. New York Native reports that AIDS caused by syphilis spirochetes
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
4. Catholic Church ejecting gay groups from their churches and forbidding them to meet or worship there
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on the marriage of an ex-gay man with AIDS in a Catholic Church
6. News Watch, bill introduced in Maryland to remove state's sodomy laws
7. LAMBDA legal defense hires a third attorney to full-time staff to deal exclusively with AIDS-related issues
8. Chicago, low income gays suffer discrimination at a greater rate and degree
9. New York, judge rules that funeral homes charging more for burial of AIDS victims are doing so illegally
10. San Francisco, Mayor Diane Feinstein announces a reward for information leading to the arrest of the murderer of two gay men in the city's Castro district in December of 1986
11. Arizona governor, Evan Mecham, declares that homosexuality is not a valid alternative lifestyle and therefore has no place in any argument concerning human rights
12. Sports Report
13. Lavender Health, interview with Dr. Joan Waitkevicz of the lesbian-centered St. Marks Women's Health Collective
14. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with William H. Hoffman, playwright of "As Is," with clips of the television film
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Vicki's Valentine Thing," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
3. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 10 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/2/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Eleanor Cooper, and Christopher [Wolfe]
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of condom distribution and the public airing of condom ads on network television, getting the gay community "condom comfortable"
COMMERCIAL: Jose Sarria for SF AIDS Foundation
4. Mandatory testing for HIV for those working in the public sector
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm demonstrates proper condom use
6. News Watch, Chicago Resource Center awards National Coalition of Black Lesbians and Gays $10,000 to support their magazine, "Black Out"
7. California Fair Employment and Housing Commission unanimously rules persons with AIDS protected against discrimination on the job
8. New Hepatitis B vaccine not derived from human blood products now in mass production and widely available
9. BBC cancels plans to air a two part educational drama on homosexuality due to heated public debate on sex education in schools
10. Sports Report
11. Lavender Health, interview with Richard Burns, executive director of the Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center in New York City
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcement of Robert Latourneau's death, clips from "Boys in the Band"
3. The late Arthur Bell's interview of Robert Latourneau from the "Emerald City Tapes"
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
4. Show Bits, George Trahanis reviews the off-Broadway production, "The Musical Comedy Murders of 1940"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
COMMERCIAL: Judge Steven Lachs for the NGTF Fund for Human Dignity
5. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 11 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/6/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of the Center for Disease Control Conference in Atlanta, and the growing nuance in AIDS discussion
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
4. Discussion of the radical Lavender Hill Mob movement and its public disturbance as a protest method
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on the conflict between organized religion and homosexuality
6. News Watch, Delaware State Insurance Commission approves gay-sensitive health insurance guidelines
7. Chicago, "gay dollar" stamps now sold by mail
8. National Gay Rights Advocates publish a tax guide for gay and lesbian men and women
9. California's State Association of Health calls for the isolated quarantining of those who are AIDS and HIV positive and are willfully spreading the virus
10. Sports Report, interview with two members of the Big Apple Softball League
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
11. Lavender Health, interview with John Thacker, director of the NYC Department of Health's Sexually Transmitted Disease Education Service
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with actor Taylor Mead, clips from Andy Warhol's "Frankenstein"
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Mona Rogers in Person," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
4. Interview series on the operating methods of GMHC, with playwright Larry Kramer, and a response by the executive director of GMHC, Richard Dunne
5. Closing credits over the end of Dunne's response which is cut off

[Air Date: 3/13/1987]

accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

phystech.head: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of Catholic Archdiocese's banning of Catholic gay rights groups from churches
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. One year anniversary of the passing of New York City's gay right bill, with clips from GCN's coverage of the event, and discussion of the progress of gay rights since the bill
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
5. Andy Humm on the growing participation of the gay community in activism
6. News Watch, Vatican newspaper criticizes condom use as a method of stopping spread of AIDS, advocating the stopping of gay sex
7. Seattle Times rejects an ad from Parents and Friends of Lesbians and Gays, due to the use of the word "gay"
8. Vermont, gay rights bill introduced in state legislature
9. Delta Airlines avoids national gay boycott after Delta agrees to meet demands of gay group, including non-discrimination of passengers with AIDS
10. Sports Report, with clips from the Dr. Ruth show
11. Lavender Health, interview with Felicia Schady, public health educator with the Hepatitis B Prevention Unit at the NYC Health Department
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
s
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with Helen [Schumaker], actress in the one-woman show, "Mona Rogers in Person," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Barbara Gelb's two-act, one-character play "My Gene"
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
4. Second part of the interview series on the operating methods of GMHC, with playwright Larry Kramer, and a response by the executive director of GMHC, Richard Dunne, tape cuts off

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/20/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of the increasing activism within the gay community, ties to "civil disobedience," and how to encourage new faces to join the protest
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. New York Times reports that Southern voters are extremely concerned with AIDS as a priority issue, discussion of how the AIDS issue will be used by politicians in the 1988 election
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation, with Jose Sarria
5. Andy Humm on the AIDS education of teenagers
6. News Watch, new study shows that the longer a person is infected with HIV, the greater their chance is of developing AIDS
7. Madison Avenue advertising firm denounce remark by Lifestyles Condoms, who stated "AIDS is a condom-marketers dream"
8. AZT renamed to Retrovir, to limit confusion in foreign countries where AZT is the name of an immuno-suppressant
9. Sacramento Union publishes profile of gay male couple for Valentine series, and receives complaints
10. Sports Report
11. Lavender Health, interview with Liz [Walker], head of Domestic Violence Services at NYC Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence Project
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Barbara Lea's cabaret show, "The Melody Lingers On"
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Naming Names segment, exposing persons in the media who misrepresent gay and lesbian people, sponsored by GLAAD: John Cardinal O'Connor
COMMERCIAL: "Suds" gay soap opera, created by GCN
4. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with Stephen McCauley, author of "Object of My Affection"
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
5. Third part of the interview series on the operating methods of GMHC, with playwright Larry Kramer, and a response by the executive director of GMHC, Richard Dunne, tape cuts off

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 14 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/27/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Coverage by Andy Humm of the AIDS crisis demonstration at Trinity Church on March 24, 1987, interview with Larry Kramer
2. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
3. Short news stories, appeal for donations
3. Discussion of the New York Times coverage of AIDS issue, quality of series and whether it was timely or too-little-too-late
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. Continued discussion of New York Times AIDS coverage
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on New York City's AIDS education
6. News Watch, Senator Pete Wilson introduces a bill to create a Congressional Advisory Panel on AIDS, headed by the National Academy of Sciences
7. Senator Dan Burton of Indiana proposes a bill for mandatory annual HIV testing for all US residents
8. New York, Queens co-op agrees to let a gay couple purchase an apartment after the couple went to the city's Commission on Human Rights
9. Congressional Hearing on AIDS Education finds that Federal response to AIDS epidemic is "slow, limited, and ultimately impotent"
10. Sports Report
11. Lavender Health, interview with Dava Weinstein, social worker, and co-chair of "10% of Those We Serve" chemical dependency conference
12. George Trahanis announces GCN's 5th anniversary, and a new pledge drive
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "A Farewell to Tom"
2. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 15 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/7/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Kitty Cotter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Discussion of the 1987 National Lesbian and Gay Health Conference, and AIDS in politics overtaking gay rights issues
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
3. Discussion of the AIDS and HIV tests, and personal issues surrounding testing
4. Andy Humm on "straightening up" a home to hide a homosexual lifestyle
5. News Watch, Georgia State Representative shelves legislation to criminalize homosexual sodomy due to controversy created
6. "Names Project," a quilt of the names of those killed by AIDS to be displayed on Washington Mall during the March on Washington
7. Philadelphia school-board condemns harassment of students based on sexual orientation, provides "sensitivity training" for teachers and administrators
8. Independent Catholic newspaper estimates that 50% of Catholic priests in the US are homosexual
9. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Lavender Health, interview with Mary Anne Chaisson, member of the Department of Health's AIDS research unit, which collects data and tracks the epidemic in NYC
11. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, Lifestyles and Trojan Condoms criticized for calling AIDS "a condom-makers dream" and refusing to advertise in gay publications
COMMERCIAL: 10th Annual Awards Evening for the Fund for Human Dignity
2. Media Watch, with Brandon Judell, interview with John Dietrich of the Islanders Club, an adventure-oriented club
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
3. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "See Spot Run"
4. Closing credits
5. COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 17 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/20/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Announcement of GCN Pledge Month
3. Discussion of openly-gay Harry Britt's loss to Nancy Pelosi for the position of Californian Democratic member of Congress, discussion of gay politicians and the gay voting block
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. Vice-President George Bush finally takes a stance on AIDS prevention and education, but only in the private sphere, also the outspokenness of Surgeon General Everett Koop
5. AIDS organizations in Puerto Rico
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
6. Anti-gay prejudice and heterosexual bias
7. News Watch, Georgetown University persuades a Maryland state representative a bill to give them funding for an expansion, after the university refused to comply with Washington DC's human rights law
8. Idaho requires those applying for a marriage license to be tested for HIV
9. Moscow, USSR opens an anonymous AIDS testing site for foreigners and those who have had sex with foreigners
10. Britain's Princess Diana opens the country's first AIDS ward, in order to dispel myth of infection by close contact
COMMERCIAL: 10th Annual Awards Evening for the Fund for Human Dignity
11. Sports Report, on location with The Times Squares, a gay-oriented square dance group
12. Lavender Health, interview with Karen Solomon, a coordinator of the AIDS Counseling and Testing Site of the NYC Department of Health, discussion of HIV test
13. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Broadway production of Harvey Fierstein's three one-acts, "Safe Sex"
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with [Frederick] Davies, star of the one-man show, "The Great Truman Capote"
3. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Catching Up is Hard to Do"
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 18 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/27/1987]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, NYU student David Strah, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Announcement of GCN Pledge Month
3. Discussion of Brooklyn College refusal to give award to anti-gay Catholic Bishop Francis J. Mugavero, the political backlash against Brooklyn College's decision, and how the gay community can confront religious bigotry
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Condom availability in prisons and in colleges, whether condoms are "catching on"
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
5. Andy Humm on the necessity of activists and volunteers in the gay community
6. News Watch, anti-gay psychologist Paul Cameron changes the name of his organization to "The Family Research Institute"
7. Oklahoma, Republican Party platform is anti-gay, despite the Republican governor's approval of sex education in schools
8. Hollywood, television shows and films win awards at the Alliance for Gay and Lesbian Artists awards for positive portrayals of gay characters
9. Dallas police arm selves with gloves, masks, and insect repellent due to fear of contracting AIDS
10. Clips from a speech by New York Governor Mario Cuomo, on the passage of an executive order for the protection of gay and lesbian employees
COMMERCIAL: Dancing Cheek to Cheek GCN event
11. Lavender Health, interview with Damien Martin, co-founder of the Institute for the Protection of Lesbian and Gay Youth and Professor at New York University, about specific needs in educating gay youths
12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:
1. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, short stories and clip of Mayor Koch talking about Ronald Reagan's inactivity regarding AIDS funding
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
2. Naming Names, criticism of Max Frankel of the New York Times
3. Episode 5 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "A Brief Crisis"
4. Closing credits
